<A NAME="eolPage2"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS; WIDTH:596.6PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI, ARIAL, SANS-SERIF;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:8PT;">
<A STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;COLOR:#003366;" HREF="#T1600851-20F_HTM_TOC">
	TABLE OF CONTENTS
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="BORDER:1PT #000 SOLID;MARGIN-TOP:27.51PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:5.68PT;MARGIN-LEFT:56.82PT;WIDTH:482.45PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:13.31PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2.72000000000003PT; MARGIN-LEFT:14.2PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:72PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:14PT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	DEAR FELLOW SHAREHOLDERS AND BUSINESS PARTNERS
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	In 2015, two significant challenges impacted our financial results from continuing operations. Firstly, ferro-alloy off-take contracts with inadequate pricing mechanisms, which have since been terminated, resulted in realized losses in a declining price environment. Secondly, the insolvency of one of our finance and supply chain customers in February&nbsp;2016 was an adjusting subsequent event which resulted in our recording credit losses in fiscal 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	In addition, declining prices resulted in non-cash impairments on our iron ore and hydrocarbon properties under our discontinued operations.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	We have taken actions to address these issues and will ensure that we learn from the lessons of 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Change in Reporting Currency
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Since 2007, we presented our financial results in United States dollars. However, as we no longer have significant assets or revenues denominated in United States dollars, combined with the fact that the majority of our stakeholders view us as a Canadian company, we have reverted our presentation currency back to the Canadian dollar. There is no impact (positive or negative) on our financial position as a result of this change. Our common shares continue to be quoted in United States dollars on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol &#8220;MFCB&#8221;. All references to dollar amounts herein are Canadian dollars unless otherwise stated.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:14PT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	I.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	WHY ARE WE LATE IN REPORTING OUR 2015 RESULTS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	In February&nbsp;2016, one of our finance and supply chain customers filed for insolvency. A customer insolvency is an adjusting subsequent event under International Accounting Standard 10,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Events after the Reporting Period
</FONT>
	, and, as a result, we had to determine an allowance for credit losses against our receivables due from the customer and its affiliates, the provisions under certain guarantees which we had made and the potential recoveries as at December&nbsp;31, 2015. The recognition and measurement of these provisions was a complex process, involving a significant degree of judgment and a high level of estimation uncertainty. This process required management to spend an extended period of time to evaluate the fact patterns, assess the collateral and reach conclusions. It is this subsequent event and the related complex measurement issues that caused our first late filing ever.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:14PT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	II.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	CONTINUING OPERATIONS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:5PT;">
	1. Long-Term Off-Take Agreements
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:6.79PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:5PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	&#8201;
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:6.79PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:449.05PT;">
	In 2015, we incurred losses in connection with four long-term ferro-alloy off-take agreements entered into by a subsidiary prior to its acquisition in 2014. These agreements had pricing mechanisms and fixed supply quantities that did not adequately address market volatility.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:7.79PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:5PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	&#8201;
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:7.79PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:449.05PT;">
	These agreements contributed a loss of&#8201; $9.9 million in 2015. We have terminated these off-take agreements and have instituted additional risk controls to mitigate our exposure to this type of market volatility going forward.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:7.79PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:5PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	&#8201;
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:7.79PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:449.05PT;">
	For illustrative purposes, the following table sets out price movements for various ferro-alloys between January&nbsp;2015 and each of June and December&nbsp;2015:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:6PT;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	LETTER TO SHAREHOLDERS
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage3"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS; WIDTH:596.6PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI, ARIAL, SANS-SERIF;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:8PT;">
<A STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;COLOR:#003366;" HREF="#T1600851-20F_HTM_TOC">
	TABLE OF CONTENTS
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="BORDER:1PT #000 SOLID;MARGIN-TOP:27.51PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:5.68PT;MARGIN-LEFT:56.82PT;WIDTH:482.45PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:13.31PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:5.15000000000009PT; MARGIN-LEFT:14.2PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:5PT;">
	2. Insolvency of a Trade Finance and Supply Chain Customer
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:7.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:5PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	&#8201;
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:7.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:449.05PT;">
	After the end of fiscal 2015, in February&nbsp;2016, a finance and supply chain customer filed for insolvency, which is an adjusting subsequent event for our 2015 consolidated financial statements under International Financial Reporting Standard (&#8220;IFRS&#8221;). As a result, in the fourth quarter of 2015, we recorded total credit losses and provisions of&#8201; $51.4 million related to this customer and its affiliates, which includes an allowance for trade receivables and provisions for potential future losses.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:8.99PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:5PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	&#8201;
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:8.99PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:449.05PT;">
	However, we hold various collateral, including guarantees, mortgages and other mitigation securities, to recover a significant portion of these losses. We are exercising our rights as we undertake various options to maximize our recoveries.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:5PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	&#8201;
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:449.05PT;">
	We currently expect that it is highly probable that we will recover at least $36.8 million of these losses in 2016. However, under applicable IFRS, our expected recoveries may only be recognized in our financial statements when there is &#8220;virtual certainty&#8221; that they will be collected.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#8220;Virtual certainty&#8221; is a very high threshold
</FONT>
	and therefore, pursuant to IFRS, we have not recorded our expected recoveries related to such credit losses in our 2015 consolidated financial statements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:5PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	&#8201;
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:449.05PT;">
	This creates a timing difference between the recording of credit losses and the recognition of the associated expected recoveries. We believe that the most probable outcome of this timing difference is that in either the second or third quarter of 2016,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	we will recognize a gain of at least $36.8 million related to these expected recoveries which will flow through our profit and loss statement
</FONT>
	. In our view, this accounting result does not truly reflect how we view these transactions from a commercial economic or risk assessment perspective.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:14PT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	III.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	DISCONTINUED OPERATIONS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	2015 was a difficult year, especially in relation to our interests in the commodity sector. During the year, we decided to discontinue the following operations:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:5PT;">
	1. Iron Ore
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:7.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:5PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	&#8201;
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:7.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:449.05PT;">
	We are the lessor under a mining lease underlying an iron ore mine in Canada. The mine had operated since 1966, but in 2015 it was closed by the operator. When the lease is terminated, we intend to re-take the mine and exercise our contractual rights. However, these rights have been delayed due to the operator filing for relief for all of their Canadian mines under the Companies&#8217; Creditors Arrangement Act of Canada.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:8.99PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:5PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	&#8201;
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:8.99PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:449.05PT;">
	While we continue to believe that the mine presents an interesting long-term opportunity, we have emphasized conservatism and prudence while we focus on our other efforts. As such, we initiated a rationalization process and have reclassified the mine and our interest in another iron ore property as discontinued operations and adjusted the carrying values to $30.0 million resulting in non-cash impairment losses of&#8201; $215.6 million (before an income tax recovery of&#8201; $46.5 million) in 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:5PT;">
	2. Hydrocarbons
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:7.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:5PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	&#8201;
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:7.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:449.05PT;">
	We have participated in the energy sector through the development, production and processing of natural gas and natural gas liquids in Alberta, Canada.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:8.99PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:5PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	&#8201;
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:8.99PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:449.05PT;">
	We initiated a process to rationalize all of these interests and reclassified them as discontinued operations. In 2015, we sold a 95% economic and controlling interest in our Southern Alberta hydrocarbon properties. The proceeds of this sale consisted of nominal and contingent consideration, which may provide potential upside should these markets recover.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:5PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	&#8201;
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:449.05PT;">
	The long-term price curves of natural gas, natural gas liquids and oil declined substantially during 2015 and, as a result, we incurred non-cash impairment losses of&#8201; $196.5 million (before a reduction of income tax assets of&#8201; $50.9 million) on our hydrocarbon assets.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:5PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	&#8201;
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:449.05PT;">
	Our hydrocarbon interests now include our Northern Alberta production and facilities, as well as certain undeveloped land and equipment. Our Northern Alberta assets are on our balance sheet at $50.0 million, net of decommissioning obligations, which we believe is a prudent and conservative valuation given the quality of the properties and the potential for growth and returns once hydrocarbon markets recover.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:5.68000000000001PT;MARGIN-LEFT:14.2PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:-1.64PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:6PT;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	ii
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:6PT;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	LETTER TO SHAREHOLDERS
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage4"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS; WIDTH:596.6PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI, ARIAL, SANS-SERIF;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:8PT;">
<A STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;COLOR:#003366;" HREF="#T1600851-20F_HTM_TOC">
	TABLE OF CONTENTS
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="BORDER:1PT #000 SOLID;MARGIN-TOP:27.51PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:5.68PT;MARGIN-LEFT:56.82PT;WIDTH:482.45PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:13.31PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:42.5899999999999PT; MARGIN-LEFT:14.2PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:14PT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	IV.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	FINANCIAL POSTION
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11.5PT;">
	As at December&nbsp;31, 2015, our cash and cash equivalents decreased to $197.5 million from $344.9 million as at December&nbsp;31, 2014, primarily as a result of the repayment of short-term borrowings and debt.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	We have decreased our short-term bank borrowings to $60.1 million as at December&nbsp;31, 2015, from $187.2 million in the prior year.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Trade receivables and other receivables were $151.2 million and $14.7 million, respectively, as at December&nbsp;31, 2015, compared to $187.6 million and $26.4 million, respectively, as at December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Inventories were $245.3 million as at December&nbsp;31, 2015. Inventories which were contracted at fixed prices or hedged were $141.3 million as at December&nbsp;31, 2015, of which $13.7 million and $127.6 million of such inventories were initially financed by suppliers and short-term bank borrowings, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	The following table highlights selected figures on our financial position as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and December&nbsp;31, 2014:
</DIV>

</TD>

</TD>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:20PT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; MARGIN-TOP:12.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:40PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#8199;&#8201;&#8201;Note: (1)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:12.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:394.05PT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	The current ratio is calculated as current assets divided by current liabilities and the total long-term debt-to-equity ratio is calculated as total long-term debt divided by shareholders&#8217; equity.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
<FONT STYLE=" TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Financial Highlights
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Revenues for 2015 increased to $1.6 billion from $1.3 billion in 2014, primarily as a result of the consolidation of our acquisitions in the second quarter of 2014 and an increase in our finance and supply chain volumes.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	In 2015, our net loss attributable to shareholders from continuing operations was $59.5 million, or $0.94 per share on a basic and diluted basis. This includes the above described pre-tax losses of&#8201; $61.3 million related to an insolvent customer and long-term off-takes that have been terminated.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Operating EBITDA from continuing operations is defined as earnings from continuing operations before interest, taxes, depreciation, depletion, amortization and impairment. Operating EBITDA from continuing operations is a non-IFRS financial measure and should not be considered in isolation or as a substitute for performance measures under IFRS. Management uses Operating EBITDA from continuing operations as a measure of our operating results and considers it to be a meaningful supplement to net income as a performance measure, primarily because we incur depreciation and depletion from time to time.
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:5.68000000000001PT;MARGIN-LEFT:14.2PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:-1.64PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:6PT;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	iii
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:6PT;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	LETTER TO SHAREHOLDERS
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR>

	Note: (1)

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:22.98PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	We expect that we will recognize a gain of at least $36.8 million related to the expected recoveries from these credit losses which will flow through our profit and loss statement in either the second or third quarter of 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
<FONT STYLE=" TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Credit Lines and Facilities with Banks
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	We established, utilized and maintain various kinds of credit lines and facilities with banks and insurers. Most of these facilities are short-term. These facilities are used in our day-to-day structured solutions and supply chain business. The amounts drawn under such facilities fluctuate with the kind and level of transactions being undertaken.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	As at December&nbsp;31, 2015, we had credit facilities aggregating $900.8 million comprised of: (i) unsecured revolving credit facilities aggregating $429.6 million from banks. The banks generally charge an interest rate of inter-bank rates plus an interest margin; (ii) revolving credit facilities aggregating $116.2 million from banks for structured solutions, a special trade financing. The margin is negotiable when the facility is used; (iii) a specially structured non-recourse factoring arrangement with a bank for up to a credit limit of&#8201; $248.7 million for our supply chain activities. We may factor our receivable accounts upon invoicing at the inter-bank rate plus a margin; (iv) foreign exchange credit facilities of&#8201; $80.4 million with banks; and (v)&nbsp;secured revolving credit facilities aggregating $25.7 million.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	All of these facilities are either renewable on a yearly basis or usable until further notice. A substantial portion of our credit facilities are denominated in Euros and, accordingly, such amounts may fluctuate when reported in Canadian dollars.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	In addition, we have margin lines with availability at multiple brokers, which enable us to hedge approximately $138.4 million notional value.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:14PT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	V.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	VISION
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Going forward, our vision is to become a regulated trade finance institution, offering our customers and suppliers a wider range of structured finance solutions including factoring, inventory, financing, forfaiting, marketing and other types of risk management and financing solutions.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	There are significant opportunities to offer structured and trade finance and banking solutions in the markets we serve as many of our customers and suppliers do not have adequate financing alternatives and could benefit from our services. Leveraging our vertically-integrated supply chain platform, we have insights into financing requirements across the value chain and the ability to offer a full portfolio of structured and trade finance and banking products will allow us to meet the needs of our business partners.
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:5.68000000000001PT;MARGIN-LEFT:14.2PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:-1.64PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:6PT;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	iv
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:6PT;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	LETTER TO SHAREHOLDERS
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI, ARIAL, SANS-SERIF;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:8PT;">

<DIV STYLE="BORDER:1PT #000 SOLID;MARGIN-TOP:27.51PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:5.68PT;MARGIN-LEFT:56.82PT;WIDTH:482.45PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:13.31PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:65.22PT; MARGIN-LEFT:14.2PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	We are making progress towards this goal:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
<FONT STYLE=" TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Acquisition of MFC Merchant Bank Ltd.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	In the first quarter of 2016, we completed the acquisition of BAWAG Malta Bank Ltd. (the &#8220;Bank&#8221;) and changed its name to MFC Merchant Bank Ltd. As part of our group, the Bank will not engage in retail banking and commercial banking, but instead will provide merchant banking and specialty banking services, focused on structured and trade finance, to our customers, suppliers, and group members, among others. The products that the Bank will offer include, among others:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:20PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:9.97PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	&#9632;
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:9.97PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:414.05PT;">
	structured and trade finance, including advisory services, in conjunction with export credit agencies;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:20PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:9.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	&#9632;
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:9.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:414.05PT;">
	merchant banking products and services, with and without recourse factoring;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:20PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:9.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	&#9632;
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:9.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:414.05PT;">
	forfaiting;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:20PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:9.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	&#9632;
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:9.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:414.05PT;">
	discounting of bills of exchange and promissory notes;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:20PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:9.97PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	&#9632;
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:9.97PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:414.05PT;">
	purchase financing collateralized by the product;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:20PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:9.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	&#9632;
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:9.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:414.05PT;">
	inventory financing collateralized by inventory and
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:20PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:9.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	&#9632;
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:9.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:414.05PT;">
	bank guarantees, letters of credit, documentary bank guarantees/stand-by letters of credit, bills of exchange, bills of lading, promissory notes and forwarders&#8217; certificate of receipt facilities.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	The Bank&#8217;s customer deposits will mainly be comprised of small and medium sized corporate clients, who may also be trade and structured finance customers, as well as our subsidiary companies and other related entities. In addition, we will integrate our existing long-standing banking relationships with the Bank to support our corporate vision.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	The back office is a significant burden to a bank because it is a major driver of operating expenditures. However, in order to maintain a variable cost structure, the Bank will outsource major back office services as well as internal functions such as technology, internal audit and payment services to third parties.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
<FONT STYLE=" TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Changes to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE=" WHITE-SPACE:PRE; TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE=" TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	our Board of Directors
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	In the last six months, two new directors, Friedrich Hondl and Jochen Duemler joined our board of directors to support our strategic priorities.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Mr. Hondl is an experienced European banking executive and former member of the Supervisory Board of Oesterreichische Kontrollbank AG, the Austrian Export Credit Agency. From 2013 to 2015, Mr. Hondl was the head of Erste Group Bank AG&#8217;s Large Corporates International Division, and from 2009 to 2012 he was the head of International Corporate Relationship Management of UniCredit Bank Austria AG. He has also served as Chairman of the Supervisory Board of Intermarket Bank AG since 2014.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Mr. Duemler was the former President and Chief Executive Officer of Euler Hermes North America, where he supervised a team of more than 500 people to permanently protect and insure approximately US$150 billion, managed all credit insurance and bonding / surety lines, and oversaw all Euler Hermes operations in the region. From 2002 to 2010, he was a member of the Board of Management of Euler Hermes Kreditversicherung AG, and from 1995 to 2002 he was a Member of the Board of Management of PRISMA Kreditversicherung AG. He is a member of the German-American Chamber of Commerce (New York City), a Member of the German Executive Roundtable (Washington, D.C.), and a board member of the German American Partnership Program.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	We are also announcing that Michael Smith, our Managing Director, was appointed as Chairman of our board of directors in March&nbsp;2016.
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:5.68000000000001PT;MARGIN-LEFT:14.2PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:-1.64PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:6PT;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	v
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:6PT;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	LETTER TO SHAREHOLDERS
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage7"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS; WIDTH:596.6PT;MIN-HEIGHT:679.42PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI, ARIAL, SANS-SERIF;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:8PT;">
<A STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;COLOR:#003366;" HREF="#T1600851-20F_HTM_TOC">
	TABLE OF CONTENTS
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="BORDER:1PT #000 SOLID;MARGIN-TOP:27.51PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:5.68PT;MARGIN-LEFT:56.82PT;WIDTH:482.45PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:13.31PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2.79999999999995PT; MARGIN-LEFT:14.2PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	VI
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	. FUTURE
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	We have clear goals and are making changes, but we have to do more.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	In 2015, we initiated a process to reduce our inventories and receivables, but it didn&#8217;t provide the necessary results. We have now started to implement changes with the goal of drastically reducing our inventories and receivables so we can reallocate capital to more profitable business units. This is expected to be substantially complete by the end of 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	We must learn from the lessons of 2015 and ensure that we do not repeat history as we work diligently to execute our vision.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
<FONT STYLE=" TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Stakeholder Communication
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	After feedback from our stakeholders, we have decided to change the format of our quarterly communication following our financial reporting:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:9.97PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	&#9632;
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:9.97PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:434.05PT;">
	Stakeholders are encouraged to read our entire audited financial statements and management&#8217;s discussion and analysis for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 in this Annual Report on Form 20-F for a greater understanding of our Company&#8217;s business and operations.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:9.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	&#9632;
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:9.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:434.05PT;">
	All stakeholders who have questions regarding the information in this Annual Report on Form 20-F may call our North American toll free line:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	+1 (844) 331 3343
</FONT>
	or International callers:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	+1&nbsp;(604) 662 8873
</FONT>
	to book a conference call with members of our senior management. Questions may also be emailed to Rene Randall at rrandall@bmgmt.com.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Management welcomes any questions you may have and looks forward to discussing our operations, results and plans with stakeholders.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Respectfully Submitted,
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Gerardo Cortina
<BR>
	President and Chief Executive Officer
</DIV>

<EFX_PART_I>
<A NAME="FIS_PART_I"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:48.82PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	PART I
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	FORWARD-LOOKING STATEMENTS
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	This document contains certain forward-looking information and statements, including statements relating to matters that are not historical facts and statements of our beliefs, intentions and expectations about developments, results and events which will or may occur in the future, which constitute &#8220;forward-looking information&#8221; within the meaning of applicable Canadian securities legislation and &#8220;forward-looking statements&#8221; within the meaning of the &#8220;safe harbor&#8221; provisions of the United States,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995
</FONT>
	, as amended, collectively referred to as &#8220;forward-looking statements&#8221;. Forward-looking statements are typically identified by words such as &#8220;anticipate&#8221;, &#8220;could&#8221;, &#8220;project&#8221;, &#8220;should&#8221;, &#8220;expect&#8221;, &#8220;seek&#8221;, &#8220;may&#8221;, &#8220;intend&#8221;, &#8220;likely&#8221;, &#8220;will&#8221;, &#8220;plan&#8221;, &#8220;estimate&#8221;, &#8220;believe&#8221; and similar expressions suggesting future outcomes or statements regarding an outlook or their negative or other comparable words. Also, discussions of strategy that involve risks and uncertainties share this &#8220;forward-looking&#8221; character.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Forward-looking statements are included throughout this document and include, but are not limited to, statements with respect to: our projected revenues; markets; production, demand and prices for products and services, including commodities; trends; economic conditions; performance; business prospects; results of operations; capital expenditures; foreign exchange rates; derivatives; and our ability to expand our business. All such forward-looking statements are based on certain assumptions and analyses made by us in light of our experience and perception of historical trends, current conditions and expected future developments, as well as other factors we believe are appropriate in the circumstances. These forward-looking statements are, however, subject to known and unknown risks and uncertainties and other factors. As a result, actual results, performance or achievements could differ materially from those expressed in, or implied by, these forward-looking statements and, accordingly, no assurance can be given that any of the events anticipated by the forward-looking statements will transpire or occur, or if any of them do so, what benefits will be derived therefrom. These risks, uncertainties and other factors include, among others, those set forth under the section entitled &#8220;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Item 3: Key Information &#8211; D. Risk Factors
</FONT>
	&#8221;.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Although we believe that the expectations reflected in such forward-looking information and statements are reasonable, we can give no assurance that such expectations will prove to be accurate. Accordingly, readers should not place undue reliance upon any of the forward-looking information and statements set out in this document. All of the forward-looking information and statements contained in this document are expressly qualified, in their entirety, by this cautionary statement. The various risks to which we are exposed are described in additional detail in this document under the section entitled &#8220;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Item 3: Key Information &#8211; D. Risk Factors
</FONT>
	&#8221;. The forward-looking information and statements are made as of the date of this document and we assume no obligation to update or revise them except as required pursuant to applicable securities laws.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	As used in this annual report, the terms &#8220;we&#8221;, &#8220;us&#8221; and &#8220;our&#8221; mean MFC Bancorp Ltd. and our subsidiaries, unless otherwise indicated.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	CHANGE IN PRESENTATION CURRENCY
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:5.81PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Effective December&nbsp;31, 2015, we changed our presentation currency from the United States dollar to the Canadian dollar. We ceased to use the United States dollar as our reporting currency because we no longer have significant assets or revenues denominated in United States dollars and because we are incorporated in Canada and our stakeholders view us as such. Prior to 2007, when we commenced reporting in United States dollars due to the concentration of assets and income denominated in United States dollars, we used the Canadian dollar as our reporting currency. Both current and historical financial information have been translated to Canadian dollars in accordance with the method described under &#8220;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Item 5: Operating and Financial Review and Prospects &#8211; Results of Operations
</FONT>
	&#8221; and Note 1 to our audited consolidated financial statements for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 for further information about our change in presentation currency. The change in presentation currency did not impact our financial position.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Unless otherwise indicated, all references in this document to &#8220;$&#8221; and &#8220;dollars&#8221; are to Canadian dollars, all references to &#8220;US$&#8221; are to United States dollars and all references to &#8220;Euro&#8221; or &#8220;&euro;&#8221; are to the European Union Euro.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	The following table sets out exchange rates, based on the Bank of Canada daily noon exchange rate, referred to as the &#8220;Noon Rate&#8221;, for the translation of United States dollars and Euros to Canadian dollars in effect at the end of the following periods, the average exchange rates during these periods (based on daily Noon Rates) and the range of high and low exchange rates for these periods:
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:22.72PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:30.62PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4.36PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;">
	1
</DIV>
</DIV>

<EFX_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT>
<A NAME="FIS_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTE ON FINANCIAL AND OTHER INFORMATION
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Unless otherwise stated, all financial information presented herein has been prepared in accordance with International Financial Reporting Standards as issued by the International Accounting Standards Board, referred to as &#8220;IFRS&#8221; and the &#8220;IASB&#8221;, respectively, which may not be comparable to financial data prepared by many U.S. companies.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Due to rounding, numbers presented throughout this document may not add up precisely to the totals we provide and percentages may not precisely reflect the absolute figures.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	All websites referred to herein are inactive textual references only, meaning that the information contained on such websites is not incorporated by reference herein and you should not consider information contained on such websites as part of this document unless expressly specified.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NON-IFRS FINANCIAL MEASURES
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	This document includes &#8220;non-IFRS financial measures&#8221;, that is, financial measures that either exclude or include amounts that are not excluded or included in the most directly comparable measure calculated and presented in accordance with IFRS. Specifically, we make use of the non-IFRS measure &#8220;Operating EBITDA from continuing operations&#8221;.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Operating EBITDA from continuing operations is defined as earnings from continuing operations before interest, taxes, depreciation, depletion, amortization and impairment. Our management uses Operating EBITDA from continuing operations as a measure of our operating results and considers it to be a meaningful supplement to net income as a performance measurement, primarily because we incur significant depreciation and depletion and the exclusion of impairment losses in Operating EBITDA from continuing operations eliminates the non-cash impact.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Operating EBITDA from continuing operations is used by investors and analysts for the purpose of valuing an issuer. The intent of Operating EBITDA from continuing operations is to provide additional useful information to investors and the measure does not have any standardized meaning under IFRS. Accordingly, this measure should not be considered in isolation or used in substitute for measures of performance prepared in accordance with IFRS. Other companies may calculate Operating EBITDA from continuing operations differently. For a reconciliation of Operating EBITDA from continuing operations to net income from continuing operations, please see &#8220;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Item 5: Operating and Financial Review and Prospects &#8211; Results of Operations
</FONT>
	&#8221;.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTE ON NATURAL GAS AND OIL DISCLOSURE AND DEFINITIONS
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Our discontinued operations include certain natural gas and oil interests located in Alberta, Canada. On March&nbsp;15, 2013, we were granted an exemption order by applicable Canadian securities regulators from the requirements of Canadian National Instrument 51-101&#8201;&#8211;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Standards of Disclosure for Oil and Gas Activities
</FONT>
	, referred to as &#8220;NI 51-101&#8221;. The exemption permits us to prepare oil and gas disclosure in accordance with the rules of the SEC. In accordance with the exemption, proved and probable reserves data and certain
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:22.72PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:30.62PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4.36PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;">
	2
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage13"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS; WIDTH:596.6PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI, ARIAL, SANS-SERIF;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:8PT;">
<A STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;COLOR:#003366;" HREF="#T1600851-20F_HTM_TOC">
	TABLE OF CONTENTS
</A>
<A NAME="T1600851-20F_HTM_TI1">
	&#8203;
</A>
<A NAME="T1600851-20F_HTM_TI2">
	&#8203;
</A>
<A NAME="T1600851-20F_HTM_TI3">
	&#8203;
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:48.82PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	other disclosures with respect to our natural gas and related activities in this document have been prepared in accordance with SEC requirements and definitions and, accordingly, may differ from corresponding information otherwise required by NI 51-101. Accordingly, such disclosures may not be comparable to those prepared by other Canadian reporting issuers.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	NI 51-101 prescribes a relatively comprehensive set of disclosures in respect of hydrocarbon reserves and other disclosures about related activities. The SEC also prescribes an extensive set of disclosures but instructs reporting companies to remain flexible in their disclosure, where appropriate, in order to provide meaningful disclosure in the circumstances. Among other differences, the SEC requirements provide for the use of pricing based on a historic 12-month average for reserves estimation and disclosure, whereas NI 51-101 requires the evaluation of oil and gas reserves to be based on a forecast of economic conditions.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Where applicable, barrels of oil equivalent amounts, referred to as &#8220;boe&#8221;, have been calculated using a conversion ratio of six thousand cubic feet of natural gas to one barrel of oil which is based on an energy equivalency conversion method primarily applicable at the burner tip and does not represent a value equivalency at the wellhead. Where applicable, boe amounts including sulphur have been calculated using a conversion ratio of one ton of sulphur to one barrel of oil. Boes may be misleading, particularly if used in isolation. In addition, the following industry specific terms are utilized in this document: (i)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	bbl/d
</FONT>
	&#8211; barrels per day; (ii)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	boe/d
</FONT>
	&#8211; barrels of oil equivalent per day; (iii)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	developed reserves
</FONT>
	&#8211; reserves that can be expected to be recovered through existing wells with existing equipment and operating methods or in which the cost of the required equipment is relatively minor compared to the cost of a new well; (iv)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	mbbl
</FONT>
	&#8211; thousand barrels; (v)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	mboe
</FONT>
	&#8211; thousand barrels of oil equivalent; (vi)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	mcf/d
</FONT>
	&#8211; thousand cubic feet per day; (vii)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	mmcf
</FONT>
	&#8211; million cubic feet; (viii)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	net acres
</FONT>
	or
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	net wells
</FONT>
	&#8211; the sum of fractional working interests owned by us in gross acres or gross wells, as applicable; (ix)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	NGL
</FONT>
	or
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	NGLs
</FONT>
	&#8211; natural gas liquid or natural gas liquids, which are naturally occurring substances found in natural gas, including ethane, butane, isobutane, propane and natural gasoline, that can be collectively removed from produced natural gas, separated into these substances and sold; (x)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	probable reserves
</FONT>
	&#8211; those additional reserves that are less certain to be recovered than proved reserves. It is equally likely that the actual remaining quantities recovered will be greater or less than the sum of the estimated proved plus probable reserves; (xi)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	producing well
</FONT>
	&#8211; a well that is not a dry well. Productive wells include producing wells and wells that are mechanically capable of production; (xii)&nbsp;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	proved reserves
</FONT>
	&#8211; those quantities of natural gas, NGL and oil, which, by analysis of geoscience and engineering data, can be estimated with reasonable certainty to be economically producible; (xiii)&nbsp;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	undeveloped reserves
</FONT>
	&#8211; reserves of any category that are expected to be recovered from new wells on undrilled acreage or from existing wells where a relatively major expenditure is required for recompletion; and (xiv)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	working interest
</FONT>
	&#8211; the interest in a property that gives the owner that share of production from the property. A working interest owner bears that share of the costs of exploration, development and production in return for a share of production. Working interests are typically burdened by overriding royalty interests or other interests.
</DIV>
</EFX_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT>

<EFX_KEY_INFORMATION>
<A NAME="FIS_KEY_INFORMATION"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ITEM 3:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;KEY INFORMATION
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:9PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	A.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Selected Financial Data
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:3PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	The following table summarizes selected consolidated financial data prepared in accordance with IFRS for the five fiscal years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. Effective December&nbsp;31, 2015, we changed our reporting currency to the Canadian dollar. Our consolidated financial statements as at and for each of the years in the four-year period ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 were reported using the United States dollar. With the change in reporting currency, all comparative financial information has been recast from United States dollars to Canadian dollars to reflect our consolidated financial statements as if they had been historically reported in Canadian dollars, consistent with IAS 21,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	The Effects of Changes in Foreign Exchange Rates
</FONT>
	, referred to as &#8220;IAS 21&#8221;. Revenues and costs of sales and services for prior periods have been reclassified to present certain transactions on a net basis. This had no impact on our net income, net income from operations, cash flow statements or financial position for such periods. Please see &#8220;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Item 5: Operating and Financial Review and Prospects &#8212; Prior Periods
</FONT>
	&#8221;. The information in the table was extracted from the
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:22.72PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:30.62PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4.36PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;">
	3
</DIV>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:5PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Notes:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; MARGIN-TOP:0.2PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(1)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:0.2PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	We commenced consolidation of the operations of two acquired supply chain companies from March&nbsp;31 and April&nbsp;1, 2014, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; MARGIN-TOP:0.2PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(2)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:0.2PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	We commenced consolidation of the operations of MFC Energy Corporation, referred to as &#8220;MFC Energy&#8221;, from September&nbsp;7, 2012.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; MARGIN-TOP:0.2PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(3)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:0.2PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Revenues and costs of sales and services for these years have been reclassified to present certain transactions on a net basis. This had no impact on our net income, net income from operations, cash flow statements or financial position for such years. Please see &#8220;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Item 5: Operating and Financial Review and Prospects &#8212; Prior Periods
</FONT>
	&#8221; for further information.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; MARGIN-TOP:0.2PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(4)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:0.2PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Includes losses of&#8201; $51.4 million related to a customer that filed for insolvency in February 2016 and $9.9 million on long-term off-take agreements entered into by a subsidiary acquired in 2014, which have since been terminated. Please see &#8220;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Item 5: Operating and Financial Review and Prospects&#8201;&#8212;&#8201;Results of Operations
</FONT>
	&#8221; for further information.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; MARGIN-TOP:0.2PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(5)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:0.2PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Includes a total non-cash impairment loss and write-down of&#8201; $48.0 million (net of income tax recovery), or $0.77 per share on a basic and diluted basis, on a subsidiary in India, which was subsequently sold in 2013.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; MARGIN-TOP:0.2PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(6)
<BR>
</DIV>

	Attributable to our shareholders.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; MARGIN-TOP:0.19PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(7)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:0.19PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Includes non-cash impairments of&#8201; $196.5 million, before a reduction of deferred tax assets of&#8201; $50.9 million, and $215.6 million, before a deferred income tax recovery of&#8201; $46.5 million, respectively, recognized on our hydrocarbon properties and iron ore interests.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; MARGIN-TOP:0.2PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(8)
<BR>
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_9"></A>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:0.2PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Includes a non-cash impairment loss on our hydrocarbon properties of&#8201; $33.2 million, before a deferred income tax recovery of $8.4 million.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; MARGIN-TOP:0.2PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(9)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:0.2PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Includes a non-cash impairment loss on our hydrocarbon properties of&#8201; $6.5 million, before an income tax recovery of&#8201; $1.7 million.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; MARGIN-TOP:0.2PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(10)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:0.2PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Includes a bargain purchase of&#8201; $212.5 million, or $3.40 per share on a basic and diluted basis, primarily in connection with our acquisition of MFC Energy. The bargain purchase arose as the consideration under the transaction was less than the fair value of the net identifiable assets acquired.
</DIV>

	&#8203;
