<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:7.39PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Notes:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; MARGIN-TOP:5.39PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(1)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:5.39PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Mr.&nbsp;Smith was appointed Chairman in March&nbsp;2016.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; MARGIN-TOP:5.38PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(2)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:5.38PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Member of our Compensation Committee.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; MARGIN-TOP:5.39PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(3)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:5.39PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Member of our Audit Committee.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; MARGIN-TOP:5.39PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(4)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:5.39PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Member of our Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; MARGIN-TOP:5.38PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(5)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:5.38PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Mr.&nbsp;Hondl was appointed a director in October&nbsp;2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; MARGIN-TOP:5.39PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(6)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:5.39PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Mr.&nbsp;D&uuml;mler was appointed a director in January&nbsp;2016.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Gerardo Cortina &#8211; President and Chief Executive Officer
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Mr.&nbsp;Cortina was appointed President and Chief Executive Officer in May&nbsp;2014. Mr.&nbsp;Cortina was managing director of Possehl Mexico S.A. de S.V., referred to as &#8220;Possehl&#8221;, from 1986 until June&nbsp;2014. Possehl has been active in trading and distribution of metals, mineral products, chemicals and ferroalloys to the iron and steel, foundry, refractory, plastics, paints, animal feed and chemicals industries. Mr.&nbsp;Cortina has successfully developed export markets in Central America, the Caribbean and South America. Mr.&nbsp;Cortina has over 25 years of experience in the supply chain business. Mr.&nbsp;Cortina has a Master of Business Administration from the Wharton School of Business at the University of Pennsylvania.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Samuel Morrow &#8211; Deputy Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Mr.&nbsp;Morrow was appointed Chief Financial Officer in June&nbsp;2014 and was appointed Deputy Chief Executive Officer in May&nbsp;2014. Mr.&nbsp;Morrow is a Chartered Financial Analyst and was most recently a Vice President of MFC in Vienna, Austria. Before joining MFC, Mr.&nbsp;Morrow was Vice President of Tanaka Capital Management and Treasurer, Chief Financial Officer and Chief Operating Officer of the Tanaka Growth Fund. Mr.&nbsp;Morrow is a graduate of St. Lawrence University.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Ferdinand Steinbauer &#8211; Treasurer
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Mr.&nbsp;Steinbauer was appointed Treasurer in March&nbsp;2014. He is currently also a Managing Director of MFC Commodities GmbH and has held that position since 1998. Previously he served as Treasurer for 20 years with KNP Leykam Austria (later acquired by SAPPI). Mr.&nbsp;Steinbauer holds a degree from the Austrian Commercial Academy in Graz and has over 35 years of experience in banking, structured trade finance and risk management.
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:22.72PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:30.62PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4.36PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;">
	42
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage53"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS; WIDTH:596.6PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI, ARIAL, SANS-SERIF;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:8PT;">
<A STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;COLOR:#003366;" HREF="#T1600851-20F_HTM_TOC">
	TABLE OF CONTENTS
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:48.82PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Michael J. Smith &#8211; Chairman and Managing Director
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Mr.&nbsp;Smith has been a director of our company since 1986 and was appointed Chairman in March&nbsp;2016. Mr.&nbsp;Smith was appointed our Managing Director in May&nbsp;2014, having served as our President and Chief Executive Officer from 1996 to 2000 and from 2010 to May&nbsp;2014 and Chief Financial Officer from 2010 to March&nbsp;2014. He was our Secretary until March&nbsp;1, 2008. Mr.&nbsp;Smith was also previously the President, Chief Executive Officer, Secretary and a director of Mass Financial Corp. and has served as a director and officer of various public companies. Mr.&nbsp;Smith has experience in corporate finance and restructuring.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Dr.&nbsp;Shuming Zhao &#8211; Director
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Dr.&nbsp;Zhao was a director of our company from 2004 until December&nbsp;2013 and was re-appointed to the board of directors in March&nbsp;2014. Dr.&nbsp;Zhao is the Chair Professor and Honorary Dean of the School of Business, Nanjing University in the People&#8217;s Republic of China. He also serves as President of the International Association of Chinese Management Research (IACMR, Third Term), Vice-President of Chinese Society of Management Modernization, President of the Jiangsu Provincial Association of Human Resource Management and Vice-President of the Jiangsu Provincial Association of Business Management and Entrepreneurs. Since 1994, Dr.&nbsp;Zhao has acted as a management consultant for several Chinese and international firms. He has also served as a director of Daqo New Energy Corp. (China) since October&nbsp;2011 and was a director of Little Swan Company, Ltd. (China) from 2009 to 2014. Dr.&nbsp;Zhao has successfully organized and held eight international symposia on multinational business management. Dr.&nbsp;Zhao worked as a visiting professor at Marshall School of Business, University of Southern California, U.S.A. in 1997 to 2003. Now he is the Distinguished Visiting Professor at the College of Business, University of Missouri-St. Louis, U.S.A. and the Distinguished Visiting Professor at the Katz Graduate School of Business, University of Pittsburgh, U.S.A. He has also lectured in various countries, including the United States, Canada, Japan, Singapore, South Korea, the United Kingdom, Germany, the Netherlands, Portugal and Australia.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Indrajit Chatterjee &#8211; Director
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Mr.&nbsp;Chatterjee has been a director of our company since 2005. He is a retired businessman who was formerly responsible for marketing with the Transportation Systems Division of General Electric for India. Mr.&nbsp;Chatterjee is experienced in dealing with Indian governmental issues.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Silke S. Stenger &#8211; Director
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Ms.&nbsp;Stenger has been a director of our company since August 2013. She is an independent business consultant and business leadership coach, was a director of our company when our company was KHD Humboldt Wedag International Ltd. from 2003 to 2010 and was a director of KHD Humboldt Wedag International AG from 2010 to 2012. Ms.&nbsp;Stenger was the Chief Financial Officer of Management One Human Capital Consultants Ltd. from 2006 to 2011. Ms.&nbsp;Stenger is a certified controller (German Chamber of Commerce IHK) and IFRS accountant, specializing in corporate governance and Sarbanes-Oxley compliance.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Friedrich Hondl &#8211; Director
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Mr.&nbsp;Hondl has been a director of our company since October&nbsp;2015. He is an experienced European banking executive and former member of the Supervisory Board of Oesterreichische Kontrollbank AG, the Austrian Export Credit Agency. From 2013 to 2015, Mr.&nbsp;Hondl was the head of Erste Group Bank AG&#8217;s Large Corporates International Division and, from 2009 to 2012, he was the head of International Corporate Relationship Management of UniCredit Bank Austria AG. Mr.&nbsp;Hondl has also served as Chairman of the Supervisory Board of Intermarket Bank AG since 2014.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Jochen D&uuml;mler &#8211; Director
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Mr.&nbsp;D&uuml;mler has been a director of our company since January&nbsp;2016. He was the former President and Chief Executive Officer of Euler Hermes North America. From 2002 to 2010, Mr.&nbsp;D&uuml;mler was a Member of the Board of Management of Euler Hermes Kreditversicherung AG and, from 1995 to 2002, he was a Member of the Board of Management of PRISMA Kreditversicherung AG. Mr.&nbsp;D&uuml;mler is a member of the German-American Chamber of Commerce (New York City), a Member of the German Executive Roundtable (Washington, D.C.) and a Board Member of the German-American Partnership Program.
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:22.72PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:30.62PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4.36PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;">
	43
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:48.82PT;HEIGHT:710.23PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Family Relationships
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	There are no family relationships between any of our directors and executive officers.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	B.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Compensation
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	During the fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, we paid an aggregate of approximately $4.5 million in cash compensation to our directors and officers, excluding directors&#8217; fees. No other funds were set aside or accrued by our company during the fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 to provide pension, retirement or similar benefits for our directors or officers pursuant to any existing plan provided or contributed to by us.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Executive Officers
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	The following table provides a summary of compensation paid by us during the fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 to our Managing Director, President and Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer and each of our two most highly compensated executive officers (or persons acting in a similar capacity) whose total compensation for the fiscal year exceeded $150,000:
</DIV>
<EFX_COMPENSATION_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_COMPENSATION_TABLE"></A>
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:454.55PT;HEIGHT:271PT;MARGIN-TOP:8PT;BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE;">
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-VARIANT:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #FFFFFF;PADDING:0PT 0PT 0.5PT 0PT; WIDTH:117.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
	&#8203;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #FFFFFF; WIDTH:4.78PT;">
	&#8203;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #FFFFFF; WIDTH:4.78PT;">
	&#8203;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING:0PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #FFFFFF;">
	&#8203;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING:0PT 0PT 0.5PT 0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #FFFFFF; MIN-WIDTH:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT; ">
	&#8203;

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:5.98PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Notes:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; MARGIN-TOP:6.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(1)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:6.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	All awards under MFC&#8217;s non-equity incentive compensation plans are paid during the financial year they were earned.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; MARGIN-TOP:6.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(2)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:6.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Consists of housing and car allowances and other customary perquisites.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; MARGIN-TOP:6.97PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(3)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:6.97PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Consists of housing allowance and other customary perquisites.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; MARGIN-TOP:6.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(4)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:6.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Consists of housing allowances and expenses.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; MARGIN-TOP:6.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(5)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:6.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Mr.&nbsp;Konsbruck has resigned, effective May&nbsp;2016.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
</DIV>

	&#8203;

<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; MARGIN-TOP:6.2PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(6)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:6.2PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Mr.&nbsp;Horn stepped down as a director in July&nbsp;2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	A total of&#8201; $0.5 million was paid to our directors for services rendered as directors, or for committee participation or assignments, during our most recently completed financial year. Our directors are each paid an annual fee of US$25,000 and US$2,500 for each director&#8217;s meeting attended as well as additional fees, as applicable, for their respective participation on our Audit and Compensation Committees. We also reimburse our directors and officers for expenses incurred in connection with their services as directors and officers.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Employment Agreements
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Michael Smith
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	In July&nbsp;2014, we entered into a two-year consulting agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Smith in connection with his appointment as our Managing Director. Pursuant to the agreement, among other things, we agreed to pay Mr.&nbsp;Smith an annual base fee of US$460,000 and an annual discretionary bonus and provide him certain customary perquisites. The agreement also entitles Mr.&nbsp;Smith to receive under our 2014 Equity Incentive Plan, referred to herein as the &#8220;2014 Plan&#8221;, which was approved by our shareholders at our 2014 Annual General and Special Meeting of Shareholders held on November&nbsp;14, 2014, referred to as the &#8220;Meeting&#8221;: (i)&nbsp;100,000 restricted stock units, which &#8220;time only&#8221; vested on the first anniversary of the grant date and the balance of which will vest on the second anniversary of the grant date; and (ii) performance share units with a target value of 200% of Mr.&nbsp;Smith&#8217;s annual base fee. If Mr.&nbsp;Smith&#8217;s engagement with us is terminated by us for any reason other than for just cause or he resigns for good reason, he will be entitled to a lump sum cash payment equal to his base fee for the balance of the term following such termination.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Gerardo Cortina
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	We entered into an employment agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Cortina effective May&nbsp;2014, in connection with his appointment as our President and Chief Executive Officer. Pursuant to the agreement, we will pay Mr.&nbsp;Cortina an annual base salary of US$650,000 (subject to annual review) and an annual discretionary
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:22.72PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:30.62PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4.36PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;">
	45
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage56"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS; WIDTH:596.6PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI, ARIAL, SANS-SERIF;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:8PT;">
<A STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;COLOR:#003366;" HREF="#T1600851-20F_HTM_TOC">
	TABLE OF CONTENTS
</A>
<A NAME="T1600851-20F_HTM_TI6C">
	&#8203;
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:48.82PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	bonus and provide him certain customary perquisites. The agreement also entitles Mr.&nbsp;Cortina to receive performance share units under the 2014 Plan with a target value of no less than 100% of his base salary for each of the years ending December&nbsp;31, 2014, 2015 and 2016. If Mr.&nbsp;Cortina&#8217;s employment is terminated by us other than for just cause, or by Mr.&nbsp;Cortina for good reason, he will be entitled to a severance payment, payable in eighteen equal monthly instalments, equal to one and a half times the sum of&#8201; (i) his current annual base salary and (ii) the higher of&#8201; (A) his current bonus and (B) the average bonus received by him in the three years prior to termination. If Mr.&nbsp;Cortina&#8217;s employment is terminated by us other than for just cause or by Mr.&nbsp;Cortina for good reason in contemplation of, or within six months of, a change of control, he will be entitled to a lump sum cash payment equal to two times the sum of&#8201; (i) his current annual base salary and (ii) the average bonus received by him in the three years prior to termination.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Samuel Morrow
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	We entered into an employment agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Morrow effective May&nbsp;2014, in connection with his appointment as our Deputy Chief Executive Officer. Pursuant to the agreement, we will pay Mr.&nbsp;Morrow an annual base salary of US$210,000 (subject to annual review) and an annual discretionary bonus and provide him certain customary perquisites. The agreement also entitles Mr.&nbsp;Morrow to receive performance share units under the 2014 Plan with a target value of at least 50% of Mr.&nbsp;Morrow&#8217;s base salary for each of the years ending December&nbsp;31, 2014, 2015 and 2016. If Mr.&nbsp;Morrow&#8217;s employment is terminated by us other than for just cause, or by Mr.&nbsp;Morrow for good reason, he will be entitled to a severance payment, payable in twelve equal monthly instalments, equal to of the sum of&#8201; (i) his current annual base salary and (ii) the higher of&#8201; (A) his current bonus and (B) the average bonus received by him in the three years prior to termination. If Mr.&nbsp;Morrow&#8217;s employment is terminated by us other than for just cause or by Mr.&nbsp;Morrow for good reason in contemplation of, or within six months of, a change of control, he will be entitled to a lump sum cash payment equal to one and one-quarter times the sum of&#8201; (i) his current annual base salary and (ii) the average bonus received by him in the three years prior to termination.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Ferdinand Steinbauer
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	We entered into an employment agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Steinbauer effective June&nbsp;2014, in connection with his appointment as our Treasurer. Pursuant to the agreement, we will pay Mr.&nbsp;Steinbauer an annual base salary of&#8201; &euro;325,000 (subject to annual review) and an annual discretionary bonus and provide him certain customary perquisites. The agreement also entitles Mr.&nbsp;Steinbauer to receive performance share units under the 2014 Plan with a target value of at least 50% of Mr.&nbsp;Steinbauer&#8217;s base salary for each of the years ending December&nbsp;31, 2014, 2015 and 2016. If Mr.&nbsp;Steinbauer&#8217;s employment is terminated by us other than for just cause, or by Mr.&nbsp;Steinbauer for good reason, he will be entitled to a severance payment, payable in fifteen equal monthly instalments, equal to one and one-quarter times the sum of&#8201; (i) his current annual base salary and (ii) the higher of&#8201; (A) his current bonus and (B) the average bonus received by him in the three years prior to termination. If Mr.&nbsp;Steinbauer&#8217;s employment is terminated by us other than for just cause or by Mr.&nbsp;Steinbauer for good reason in contemplation of, or within six months of, a change of control, he will be entitled to a lump sum cash payment equal to one and a half times the sum of&#8201; (i) his current annual base salary and (ii) the average bonus received by him in the three years prior to termination.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Pension Plan Benefits
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we did not have any defined benefit, defined contribution or deferred compensation plans for any of our senior officers or directors.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	C.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Board Practices
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	In November&nbsp;2014, to effect a special resolution adopted by our shareholders at the Meeting, we amended Article 11.1 of our Articles to remove the provision for three-year staggered terms for our directors and replace it with a provision for annual director retirement from office and re-election on a one-year term. As a result, each of our directors now holds office until the close of the next annual general meeting of our shareholders or until his or her successor is elected or appointed, unless such office is earlier vacated in accordance with our Articles or with the provisions of the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Business Corporations Act
</FONT>
	(British Columbia).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Other than as discussed elsewhere herein, there are no service contracts between our company and any of our directors providing for benefits upon termination of employment.
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:22.72PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:30.62PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4.36PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;">
	46
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage57"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS; WIDTH:596.6PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI, ARIAL, SANS-SERIF;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:8PT;">
<A STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;COLOR:#003366;" HREF="#T1600851-20F_HTM_TOC">
	TABLE OF CONTENTS
</A>
<A NAME="T1600851-20F_HTM_TI6D">
	&#8203;
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:48.82PT;HEIGHT:710.23PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Our board of directors has established an Audit Committee. Our Audit Committee currently consists of Silke S. Stenger, Dr.&nbsp;Shuming Zhao and Friedrich Hondl, who was appointed to the Audit Committee in November&nbsp;2015. The Audit Committee operates pursuant to a charter adopted by the board of directors on October&nbsp;26, 2013, a copy of which is available online at our website at www.mfcbancorpltd.com. The Audit Committee is appointed by and generally acts on behalf of the board of directors. The Audit Committee is responsible primarily for monitoring: (i) the integrity of our financial statements; (ii)&nbsp;compliance with legal and regulatory requirements; (iii) the independence, qualifications and performance of our independent auditors; and (iv) the performance and structure of our internal audit function. The Audit Committee also reviews and approves our hiring policies, establishes our procedures for dealing with complaints, oversees our financial reporting processes and consults with management and our independent auditors on matters related to our annual audit and internal controls, published financial statements, risk assessment and risk management, accounting principles and auditing procedures being applied.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Our board of directors has established a Compensation Committee. Our Compensation Committee currently consists of Indrajit Chatterjee, Silke S. Stenger, Dr.&nbsp;Shuming Zhao and Jochen D&uuml;mler. Our Compensation Committee operates pursuant to a charter adopted by the board of directors on October&nbsp;26, 2013, a copy of which is available online at our website at www.mfcbancorpltd.com. The Compensation Committee is appointed and generally acts on behalf of the board of directors. The Compensation Committee is responsible for reviewing our board compensation practices and our selection, retention and remuneration arrangements for our executive officers and employees and reviewing and approving our Chief Executive Officer&#8217;s compensation in light of our corporate goals and objectives. Except for plans that are, in accordance with their terms or as required by law, administered by our board of directors or another particularly designated group, the Compensation Committee also administers and implements all of our incentive compensation plans and equity-based compensation plans. The Compensation Committee also recommends changes or additions to those plans, monitors our succession planning processes and reports to our board of directors on other compensation matters. Our Chief Executive Officer does not vote upon or participate in the deliberations regarding his compensation.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Our board of directors has established a Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee. Our Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee currently consists of Indrajit Chatterjee, Silke S. Stenger and Dr.&nbsp;Shuming Zhao. Our Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee operates pursuant to a charter adopted by our board of directors on October&nbsp;26, 2013, a copy of which is available online at our website at www.mfcbancorpltd.com. The primary function of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee is to assist our board of directors in developing our Corporate Governance Guidelines and monitor the board and management&#8217;s performance against the defined approach. The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee is also responsible for evaluating the board and board committees&#8217; structure and size and the independence of existing and prospective directors, identifying and reporting on candidates to be nominated to our board of directors, reporting on the board&#8217;s annual performance and overseeing our process for providing information to the board.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	D.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Employees
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, we employed approximately 651, 809 and 951 people, respectively.
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:22.72PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:30.62PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4.36PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;">
	47
</DIV>

	Notes:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; MARGIN-TOP:3.8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(1)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:3.8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; MARGIN-TOP:5.79PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(2)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:5.79PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Mr.&nbsp;Hondl was elected as a director in October&nbsp;2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; MARGIN-TOP:5.8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(3)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:5.8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	We entered into a share purchase agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Cortina in April&nbsp;2014, pursuant to which he may acquire an additional 50,000 of our common shares per year until 2025 if Possehl achieves certain annual milestones. Please see &#8220;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Item 7: Major Shareholders and Related Party Transactions &#8211; B. Related Party Transactions
</FONT>
	&#8221; for further information.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; MARGIN-TOP:5.8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(4)
<BR>
</DIV>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; MARGIN-TOP:5.79PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(5)
<BR>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;

<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; MARGIN-TOP:5.8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(6)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:5.8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Mr.&nbsp;Kellogg stepped down as Chairman and as a director in July&nbsp;2015. Mr.&nbsp;Kellogg controls 13,405,000 of our common shares through IAT. In his public filings, Mr.&nbsp;Kellogg disclaims beneficial ownership of any shares owned by IAT. In addition, in his public filings, Mr.&nbsp;Kellogg disclaims beneficial ownership of 1,200,000 common shares of our company owned by his wife, Cynthia Kellogg.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;

	(7)

	(8)

<BR>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	2014 Equity Incentive Plan
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	At our annual and special meeting of our shareholders held in November&nbsp;2014, our shareholders passed a resolution approving our 2014 Plan to further align the interests of employees and directors with those of our shareholders by providing incentive compensation opportunities tied to the performance of our common shares and promoting increased ownership of our common shares by such individuals. The 2014 Plan replaced our 1997 Stock Option Plan and our 2008 Incentive Plan and any plans emanating or
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:22.72PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:30.62PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4.36PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;">
	48
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage59"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS; WIDTH:596.6PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI, ARIAL, SANS-SERIF;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:8PT;">
<A STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;COLOR:#003366;" HREF="#T1600851-20F_HTM_TOC">
	TABLE OF CONTENTS
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:48.82PT;HEIGHT:710.23PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	deriving therefrom, collectively referred to as the &#8220;Prior Plans&#8221;; provided, however, that each applicable Prior Plan will continue to govern prior awards granted under such Prior Plan until all awards granted under such Prior Plan prior to November&nbsp;14, 2014 have been exercised, forfeited, cancelled, expired or otherwise terminated in accordance with the terms thereof.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Pursuant to the terms of the 2014 Plan, our board of directors, our Compensation Committee or such other committee as is appointed by our board of directors to administer the 2014 Plan, may grant stock options, restricted stock rights, restricted stock, performance share awards, performance share units and stock appreciation rights under the 2014 Plan, establish the terms and conditions for those awards, construe and interpret the 2014 Plan and establish the rules for the 2014 Plan&#8217;s administration. Such awards may be granted to employees, non-employee directors, officers or consultants of ours or any affiliate or any person to whom an offer of employment with us or any affiliate is extended. Such committee has the authority to determine which employees, non-employee directors, officers, consultants and prospective employees should receive such awards.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	The maximum number of our common shares that may be issuable pursuant to all awards granted under the 2014 Plan is 2,877,018 common shares, being 2,000,000 plus the number of common shares available for awards under the Prior Plans as of the effective date of the 2014 Plan. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the maximum number of shares that may be issued as incentive stock options under the 2014 Plan is 2,000,000. Forfeited, cancelled, returned and lapsed awards are not counted against the 2,000,000 common shares. Any awards granted under the 2014 Plan, or portions thereof, that are settled in cash and not by issuance of our common shares are not counted against the foregoing limits. No awards had been issued pursuant to the 2014 Plan as at December&nbsp;31, 2015. There were 2,877,018 awards available for grant under the 2014 Plan as at December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	As at December&nbsp;31, 2015, the following option awards were outstanding under the Prior Plans: (i)&nbsp;1,372,500 stock options under our 1997 Stock Option Plan; and (ii) 860,000 stock options under our 2008 Incentive Plan.
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:22.72PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:30.62PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4.36PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;">
	49
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:5.98PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Notes:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; MARGIN-TOP:3.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(1)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:3.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Based on 63,142,272 common shares issued and outstanding on April&nbsp;29, 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; MARGIN-TOP:6.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(2)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:6.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Mr. Kellogg controls 13,405,000 of our common shares through IAT. In his public filings, Mr. Kellogg disclaims beneficial ownership of all of the shares, or approximately 21.2% of the issued and outstanding common shares, owned by IAT. In addition, in his public filings, Mr. Kellogg disclaims beneficial ownership of 1,200,000 common shares of our company owned by his wife, Cynthia Kellogg.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; MARGIN-TOP:6.97PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(3)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:6.97PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:10PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Mr. Miller controls such shares through a number of trusts and wholly-owned corporations. In his public filings, Mr. Miller discloses that he exercises sole dispositive and voting control over 6,253,738 of such shares and shared dispositive and voting control over 432,595 of such shares.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	As of April&nbsp;1, 2016, there were 63,142,272 common shares issued and outstanding held by 386 registered shareholders. Of those common shares issued and outstanding, 63,115,522 common shares were registered in the United States (347 registered shareholders).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	The voting rights of our major shareholders do not differ from the voting rights of holders of our shares who are not major shareholders.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Peter Kellogg may be considered to control our company as a result of, among other things, his ownership of approximately 32.7% of our common shares. However, on February&nbsp;7, 2014, we entered into a mutual settlement agreement with Peter Kellogg and IAT, pursuant to which, among other things, Mr.&nbsp;Kellogg and IAT agreed to abide by customary standstill provisions for a 30-month period, subject to earlier termination in accordance with its terms. Please refer to &#8220;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Item 10:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Additional Information &#8211; C. Material Contracts
</FONT>
	&#8221; for further information.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	There are no arrangements known to us, the operation of which may at a subsequent date result in a change in the control of our company.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; MARGIN-TOP:15.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	B.
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:15.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Related Party Transactions
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Other than as disclosed herein, to the best of our knowledge, since January&nbsp;1, 2015, there have been no material transactions or loans between our company and: (a) enterprises that directly or indirectly through one or more intermediaries control or are controlled by, or are under common control with, our company; (b) associates; (c) individuals owning, directly or indirectly, an interest in the voting power of our company that gives them significant influence over our company, and close members of any such individual&#8217;s family; (d) key management personnel of our company, including directors and senior management of our company and close members of such individuals&#8217; families; or (e) enterprises in which a substantial interest in the voting power is owned, directly or indirectly, by any person described in (c) or (d) or over which such a person is able to exercise significant influence.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	In the normal course of operations, we enter into transactions with related parties, which include, among others, affiliates whereby we have a significant equity interest (10% or more) in the affiliates or have the ability to influence the affiliates&#8217; or our operating and financing policies through significant shareholding, representation on the board of directors, corporate charter and/or bylaws. The affiliates also include certain of our directors, our President, Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer, Treasurer, Chief Operating Officer and their close family members.
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:22.72PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:30.62PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4.36PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;">
	50
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	In addition to transactions disclosed elsewhere in our financial statements for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and in this annual report on Form 20-F, we had the following transactions with affiliates during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015:
</DIV>
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:376.55PT;HEIGHT:23.5PT;MARGIN-LEFT:39PT;MARGIN-TOP:8PT;BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE;">
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:8PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-VARIANT:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">

<TD STYLE="PADDING:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #FFFFFF; WIDTH:6PT;">

<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;PADDING:0PT 0PT 2.5PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;" COLSPAN="3">

	(In thousands)
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TD STYLE="PADDING:3.25PT 0PT 2.5PT 0PT; WIDTH:304.55PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<DIV STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	Sale of Goods
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING:0PT; WIDTH:6PT;">
	&#8203;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING:0PT; WIDTH:6PT;">
	&#8203;

<TD STYLE="PADDING:0PT;PADDING-LEFT:1.05PT;WIDTH:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING:3.25PT 0PT 2.5PT 0PT; MIN-WIDTH:3.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT; ">
	$
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING:3.25PT 0PT 2.5PT 0PT; MIN-WIDTH:37.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT; WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	&#8199;&#8199;&#8201;&#8199;&#8201;&#8201;&#8201;&#8201;&#8201;3,349
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16.98PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	In April&nbsp;2014, we entered into a share purchase agreement with the holder of the puttable instrument financial liabilities, referred to as the &#8220;Put Holder&#8221;, whereby we acquired from the Put Holder his 40% equity shares in Possehl. Upon the execution of the agreement, the puttable instrument was terminated. The purchase price consisted of 509,820 of our common shares (which would be delivered upon occurrence of an event (as defined in the agreement), the latest being in 2025) and a contingent purchase price whereby 50,000 of our common shares would be issued to the Put Holder for each year from 2014 to 2025 if Possehl achieves an annual net income milestone as computed under IFRS for the year. In June&nbsp;2014, the share purchase agreement was amended whereby the 509,820 of our common shares were released to the Put Holder following the approval of the New York Stock Exchange, referred to as the &#8220;NYSE&#8221;, (which was received in June&nbsp;2014) and the contingent purchase price was reduced to be payable for each year from 2014 to 2024. All other terms remain unchanged. The Put Holder was appointed to our board of directors and as our President and Chief Executive Officer in May&nbsp;2014. The annual target was achieved for 2014. As a result, we issued 50,000 common shares to the Put Holder in the first half of 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; MARGIN-TOP:15.99PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	C.
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:15.99PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Interests of Experts and Counsel
</DIV>

	&#8203;

	Not applicable.
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ITEM 8:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; FINANCIAL INFORMATION
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; MARGIN-TOP:14.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	A.
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:14.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Consolidated Statements and Other Financial Information
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Effective January&nbsp;1, 2010, we adopted IFRS following approval from the Canadian Securities Administrators under National Instrument 52-107 &#8211;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Acceptable Accounting Principles and Auditing Standards
</FONT>
	. The consolidated financial statements have been prepared in compliance with IFRS. See &#8220;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Item 18: Financial Statements
</FONT>
	&#8221;.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Legal Proceedings
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	We are subject to routine litigation incidental to our business and are named from time to time as a defendant in various legal actions arising in connection with our activities, certain of which may include large claims for punitive damages. Further, due to the size, complexity and nature of our operations, various legal and tax matters are outstanding from time to time, including a currently ongoing audit by the Canadian taxation authority of our domestic and international transactions covering the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 to April&nbsp;19, 2013. Currently, based upon information available to us, we do not believe any such matters would have a material adverse effect upon our financial condition or results of operations. However, due to the inherent uncertainty of litigation, we cannot provide certainty as to their outcome. If our current assessments are materially incorrect or if we are unable to resolve any of these matters favorably, there may be a material adverse impact on our financial performance, cash flows or results of operations. Please see Note 13 to our audited consolidated financial statements for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 for further information.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Dividend Distributions
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Our board of directors declared annual cash dividends per common share, payable in four quarterly installments of US$0.24 in each of 2013 and 2014. No dividend was declared in 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; MARGIN-TOP:15.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	B.
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:15.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">

</FONT>
	&#8221; and Note 29 of our annual financial statements included herewith for a discussion of significant events that have occurred after December&nbsp;31, 2015.

<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	F.
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Expenses of the Issue
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;

	Not applicable.
</DIV>
</EFX_LISTING>
<EFX_ADDITIONAL_INFORMATION>
<A NAME="FIS_ADDITIONAL_INFORMATION"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ITEM 10: &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	A.
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Share Capital
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Not applicable.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; MARGIN-TOP:13PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	B.
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:13PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Memorandum and Articles of Association
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	We are organized under the laws of the Province of British Columbia, Canada and have been assigned the number BC0778539.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Our Articles do not contain a description of our objects and purposes.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Our Articles do not restrict a director&#8217;s power to vote on a proposal, arrangement or contract in which the director is materially interested, vote on compensation to themselves or any other members of their body in the absence of an independent quorum or exercise borrowing powers. There is no mandatory retirement age for our directors and our directors are not required to own securities of our company in order to serve as directors.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Our authorized capital consists of an unlimited number of common shares without par value, an unlimited number of Class A common shares without par value and an unlimited number of Class A preferred shares without par value. Our Class A preferred shares may be issued in one or more series and our directors may fix the number of shares that is to comprise each series and designate the rights, privileges, restrictions and conditions attaching to each series.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Holders of our common shares may receive dividends when, as and if declared by the board, subject to the preferential dividend rights of any other classes or series of preferred shares issued and outstanding. In no event may a dividend be declared or paid on the common shares if payment of the dividend would cause the realizable value of the assets of our company to be less than the aggregate of its liabilities. Holders of our common shares are entitled to one vote per share at any meeting of shareholders of any class of common shares and, in general and subject to applicable law, all matters will be determined by a majority of votes cast other than fundamental changes with respect to our company. The common shareholders are entitled, in the event of a distribution of assets of our company on the liquidation, dissolution or winding-up of our company, referred to as a &#8220;Liquidation Distribution&#8221;, to receive, before any Liquidation Distribution is made to the holders of the Class A common shares or any other shares of our company ranking junior to the common shares, but after any prior rights of any of our preferred shares, the stated capital with respect to each common share held by them, together with all declared and unpaid dividends (if any and if preferential) thereon, up to the date of such Liquidation Distribution, and thereafter the common shares shall rank
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	pari passu
</FONT>
	with all other classes of our common shares in connection with the Liquidation Distribution.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	The rights and restrictions attaching to our Class A common shares are the same as those attaching to our common shares, except that, in the event of a Liquidation Distribution, the holders of the Class A common shares are entitled to receive such Liquidation Distribution only after any prior rights of the preferred shares and common shares or any other share ranking prior in right to the Class A common shares.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Our Class A preferred shares of each series rank on a parity with our Class A preferred shares of any other series and are entitled to a preference over our common shares with respect to the payment of dividends and the distribution of assets or return of capital in the event of liquidation, dissolution or winding-up of our company.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	The provisions in our Articles attaching to our common shares and Class A preferred shares may be altered, amended, repealed, suspended or changed by the affirmative vote of the holders of not less than two-thirds of the common shares and two-thirds of the Class A preferred shares, respectively, present in person or by proxy at any such meeting of holders.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Our Articles provide for the election of directors at each annual general meeting. Each director holds office until the next annual general meeting of our shareholders or until his successor is elected or appointed, unless his office is earlier vacated in accordance with our Articles or with the provisions of the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Business Corporations Act
</FONT>
	(British Columbia).
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:22.72PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:30.62PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4.36PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;">
	53
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage64"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS; WIDTH:596.6PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI, ARIAL, SANS-SERIF;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:8PT;">
<A STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;COLOR:#003366;" HREF="#T1600851-20F_HTM_TOC">
	TABLE OF CONTENTS
</A>
<A NAME="T1600851-20F_HTM_TI10C">
	&#8203;
</A>
<A NAME="T1600851-20F_HTM_TI10D">
	&#8203;
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:48.82PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	An annual meeting of shareholders must be held at such time in each year that is not later than fifteen months after the last preceding annual meeting and at such place as our board of directors, or failing it, our Chairman, Managing Director or President, may from time to time determine. The holders of not less than five percent of our issued shares that carry the right to vote at a meeting may requisition our directors to call a meeting of shareholders for the purposes stated in the requisition. The quorum for the transaction of business at any meeting of shareholders is two persons who are entitled to vote at the meeting in person or by proxy. Only persons entitled to vote, our directors and auditors and others who, although not entitled to vote, are otherwise entitled or required to be present, are entitled to be present at a meeting of shareholders.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Except as provided in the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Investment Canada Act
</FONT>
	, there are no limitations specific to the rights of non-Canadians to hold or vote our common shares under the laws of Canada or British Columbia, or in our charter documents. See the section of this annual report on Form 20-F entitled &#8220;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Exchange Controls
</FONT>
	&#8221; below for a discussion of the principal features of the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Investment Canada Act
</FONT>
	for non-Canadian residents proposing to acquire our common shares.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	As set forth above, our Articles contain certain provisions that would have an effect of delaying, deferring or preventing a change in control of our company, including authorizing the issuance by our board of directors of preferred stock in series, and limiting the persons who may call special meetings of shareholders. Our Articles do not contain any provisions that would operate only with respect to a merger, acquisition or corporate restructuring of our company. In addition, on November&nbsp;18, 2013, we adopted an advance notice policy, which, among other things, fixes a deadline by which director nominations must be submitted to us prior to our meetings of shareholders and sets forth the information that must be included in such notice in order for such nominee to be eligible for election. In the case of an annual meeting, notice must be given to us not less than 30 nor more than 65 days prior to the date of such meeting; provided that if the meeting is to be held on a date that is less than 50 days after the date on which the first public announcement of the date of such meeting was made, notice may be given no later than the close of business on the 10th day following such announcement. In the case of a special meeting called for the purpose of electing directors that is not also an annual meeting, notice must be provided to us no later than the close of business on the 15th day following the day on which the first public announcement of the date of such special meeting was made.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Our Articles do not contain any provisions governing the ownership threshold above which shareholder ownership must be disclosed.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Our Articles are not significantly different from the requirements of the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Business Corporations Act
</FONT>
	(British Columbia) and the conditions imposed by our Articles governing changes in capital are not more stringent than what is required by the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Business Corporations Act
</FONT>
	(British Columbia).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; MARGIN-TOP:13PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	C.
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:13PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Material Contracts
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	The following summary of certain material provisions of each agreement referenced below is not complete and these provisions are qualified in their entirety by reference to the full text of such agreement.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	On February&nbsp;7, 2014, we entered into an agreement with Peter Kellogg and IAT in connection with the settlement of litigation between the parties. Pursuant to such agreement, among other things, each party agreed to provide the other with a mutual release and Mr. Kellogg and IAT agreed to abide by certain customary standstill provisions for a 30-month period, subject to earlier termination in accordance with its terms.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; MARGIN-TOP:13PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	D.
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:13PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:434.05PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Exchange Controls
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	There are presently no governmental laws, decrees or regulations in Canada that restrict the export or import of capital or that impose foreign exchange controls or affect the remittance of interest, dividends or other payments to non-resident holders of our common shares. However, any remittances of dividends to shareholders not resident in Canada are subject to withholding tax in Canada. See &#8220;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Item 10: Additional Information &#8211; E. Taxation
</FONT>
	&#8221;.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Except as provided in the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Investment Canada Act
</FONT>
	, there are no limitations specific to the rights of non-Canadians to hold or vote our common shares under the laws of Canada or British Columbia or in our charter documents. The following summarizes the principal features of the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Investment Canada Act
</FONT>
	for non-Canadian residents proposing to acquire our common shares.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	This summary is of a general nature only and is not intended to be, and should not be construed to be, legal advice to any holder or prospective holder of our common shares and no opinion or representation to any holder or prospective holder of our common shares is hereby made. Accordingly, holders and prospective
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:22.72PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:30.62PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4.36PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;">
	54
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage65"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS; WIDTH:596.6PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI, ARIAL, SANS-SERIF;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:8PT;">
<A STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;COLOR:#003366;" HREF="#T1600851-20F_HTM_TOC">
	TABLE OF CONTENTS
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:48.82PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	holders of our common shares should consult with their own legal advisors with respect to the consequences of purchasing and owning our common shares.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	The
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Investment Canada Act
</FONT>
	governs the direct or indirect acquisition of control of an existing Canadian business by non-Canadians. Under the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Investment Canada Act
</FONT>
	, non-Canadian persons or entities acquiring &#8220;control&#8221; (as defined in the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Investment Canada Act
</FONT>
	) of a corporation carrying on business in Canada are required to either notify, or file an application for review with, Industry Canada, unless a specific exemption, as set out in the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Investment Canada Act
</FONT>
	, applies. Industry Canada may review any transaction that results in the direct or indirect acquisition of control of a Canadian business, where the enterprise value of corporate assets exceeds certain threshold levels (which are higher for investors from members of the World Trade Organization, including United States residents, or World Trade Organization member-controlled companies) or where the activity of the business is related to Canada&#8217;s cultural heritage or national identity. For such purpose, enterprise value is calculated as follows: (i) in the case of a publicly traded Canadian business, as the company&#8217;s market capitalization, plus its non-operating liabilities, minus its cash and cash equivalents; (ii) in the case of a non-publicly traded Canadian business, as the acquisition value, plus the company&#8217;s non-operating liabilities, minus its cash and cash equivalents; and (iii) in the case of an asset acquisition, as the purchase price, plus the assumed non-operating liabilities, minus the transferred cash and cash equivalents.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	No acquisition of control will be deemed to have occurred, for purposes of the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Investment Canada Act
</FONT>
	but subject to certain exceptions, if less than one-third of the voting shares of a Canadian corporation is acquired by an investor. In addition, the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Investment Canada Act
</FONT>
	permits the Canadian government to review any investment where the responsible Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that an investment by a non-Canadian could be injurious to national security or where the responsible Minister determines there has been an acquisition of control in fact by a state-owned enterprise. No financial threshold applies to a national security review and a lower financial threshold based on book value of assets applies to direct acquisitions by state-owned enterprises. The Minister may deny the investment, ask for undertakings, provide terms or conditions for the investment or, where the investment has already been made, require divestment. Review can occur before or after closing and may apply to corporate re-organizations where there is no change in ultimate control.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	If an investment is reviewable under the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Investment Canada Act
</FONT>
	, an application for review in the form prescribed is normally required to be filed with Industry Canada prior to the investment taking place and the investment may not be implemented until the review has been completed and the Minister responsible for the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Investment Canada
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Act
</FONT>
	is satisfied that the investment is likely to be of net benefit to Canada. If the Minister is not satisfied that the investment is likely to be of net benefit to Canada, the non-Canadian applicant must not implement the investment or, if the investment has been implemented, the applicant may be required to divest itself of control of the Canadian business that is the subject of the investment. The Minister is required to provide reasons for a decision that an investment is not of net benefit to Canada.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Certain transactions relating to our common shares will generally be exempt from the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Investment Canada Act
</FONT>
	, subject to the Minister&#8217;s prerogative to conduct a national security review, including:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:20PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:8.38PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	(a)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:8.38PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:414.05PT;">
	the acquisition of our common shares by a person in the ordinary course of that person&#8217;s business as a trader or dealer in securities;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:20PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:8.39PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	(b)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:8.39PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:414.05PT;">
	the acquisition of control of our company in connection with the realization of security granted for a loan or other financial assistance and not for a purpose related to the provisions of the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Investment Canada Act
</FONT>
	, provided such acquisitions are subject to approval under the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Bank Act
</FONT>
	, the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Cooperative Credit Associations Act
</FONT>
	, the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Insurance Companies Act
</FONT>
	or the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Trust and Loan Companies Act
</FONT>
	; and
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:20PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:8.38PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	(c)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:8.38PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:414.05PT;">
	the acquisition of control of our company by reason of an amalgamation, merger, consolidation or corporate reorganization, following which the ultimate direct or indirect control in fact of our company, through ownership of our common shares, remains unchanged.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	An acquisition of control of our company in connection with the realization of security granted for a loan or other financial assistance and not for a purpose related to the provisions of the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Investment Canada Act
</FONT>
	will not be reviewable under the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Investment Canada Act
</FONT>
	if the acquisition is not subject to approval under the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Bank Act
</FONT>
	, the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Cooperative Credit Associations Act
</FONT>
	, the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Insurance Companies Act
</FONT>
	or the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Trust and Loan Companies Act
</FONT>
	.
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:22.72PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:30.62PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4.36PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;">
	55
</DIV>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS; WIDTH:596.6PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
