	&#8203;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16.98PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Fair value of a financial instrument represents the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction in the principal (or most advantageous) market at the measurement date under current market conditions regardless of whether that price is directly observable or estimated using a valuation technique. The price for a transaction which takes place under duress or the seller is forced to accept the price in the transaction might not represent the fair value of an asset or a liability. The best evidence of fair value is published price quotations in an active market. When the market for a financial asset or financial liability is not active, the Group establishes fair value by using a valuation technique. The valuation technique used maximizes the use of inputs observed in active markets, and minimizes the use of inputs generated by the Group. Internally generated inputs take into account factors that market participants would consider when pricing the financial instruments, such as liquidity and credit risks. Use of judgment is significantly involved in estimating fair value of financial instruments in inactive markets and actual results could materially differ from the estimates. To value longer-term transactions and transactions in less active markets for which pricing information is not generally available, unobservable inputs may be used.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	The fair values of short-term trading securities are based on quoted market prices (Level 1 fair value hierarchy). The fair values of available-for-sale securities are based on quoted market prices, except for those which are not quoted in an active market which are estimated using an appropriate valuation method (Level 3 fair value hierarchy). Investments in equity instruments that do not have a quoted price in an active market and whose fair value cannot be reliably measured are measured at cost. The carrying amounts of cash and cash equivalents, restricted cash, short-term cash deposits, short-term receivables, short-term borrowings and account payables and accrued expenses, due to their short-term nature and normal trade credit terms, approximate their fair values. The fair values of long-term receivables, long-term debt and other long-term liabilities are determined using discounted cash flows at prevailing market rates of interest for similar instruments with similar credit ratings (Level 2 fair value hierarchy).
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:22.72PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:30.62PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4.36PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;">
	127
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage138"></A>

<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI, ARIAL, SANS-SERIF;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:8PT;">

	TABLE OF CONTENTS

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	MFC BANCORP LTD.

	(FORMERLY MFC INDUSTRIAL LTD.)

	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS

	DECEMBER 31, 2015

	&#8199;

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:1PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 26.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Financial Instruments&#8201;(continued)
<BR>
	&#8199;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:1PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	The fair values of derivative financial instruments are based on quoted market prices when possible; and if not available, estimates from third-party brokers. These broker estimates are corroborated with multiple sources and/or other observable market data utilizing assumptions that market participants would use when pricing the asset or liability, including assumptions about risk and market liquidity (Level 2 fair value hierarchy). Inputs may be readily observable or market-corroborated.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12.99PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Generally, management of the Group believes that current financial assets and financial liabilities, due to their short-term nature, do not pose significant financial risks. The Group uses various financial instruments to manage its exposure to various financial risks. The policies for controlling the risks associated with financial instruments include, but are not limited to, standardized company procedures and policies on matters such as hedging of risk exposures, avoidance of undue concentration of risk and requirements for collateral (including letters of credit and bank guarantees) to mitigate credit risk. The Group has risk managers and other personnel to perform checking functions and risk assessments so as to ensure that the Group&#8217;s procedures and policies are complied with.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Many of the Group&#8217;s strategies, including the use of derivative instruments and the types of derivative instruments selected by the Group, are based on historical trading patterns and correlations and the Group&#8217;s management&#8217;s expectations of future events. However, these strategies may not be fully effective in all market environments or against all types of risks. Unexpected market developments may affect the
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:22.72PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:30.62PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4.36PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;">
	128
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI, ARIAL, SANS-SERIF;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:8PT;">

	TABLE OF CONTENTS
</A>

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_89"></A>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	MFC BANCORP LTD.
<BR>
	(FORMERLY MFC INDUSTRIAL LTD.)
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
<BR>
	DECEMBER 31, 2015
<BR>
	&#8199;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:1PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 26.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Financial Instruments&#8201;(continued)
<BR>
	&#8199;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:1PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Group&#8217;s risk management strategies during the period, and unanticipated developments could impact the Group&#8217;s risk management strategies in the future. If any of the variety of instruments and strategies the Group utilizes is not effective, the Group may incur losses.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	The Group does not trade in financial instruments, including derivative financial instruments, for speculative purposes.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	The nature of the risks that the Group&#8217;s financial instruments are subject to as at December&nbsp;31, 2015 is set out in the following table:
</DIV>
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:454.55PT;HEIGHT:167.5PT;MARGIN-TOP:8PT;BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE;">
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:8PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-VARIANT:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #FFFFFF;PADDING:0PT 0PT 0.5PT 0PT; WIDTH:233.75PT;">
	&#8203;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #FFFFFF; WIDTH:6PT;">
	&#8203;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #FFFFFF; WIDTH:6PT;">
	&#8203;

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16.38PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	A sensitivity analysis for each type of market risk to which the Group is exposed on its financial instruments at the end of the reporting period is provided, showing how profit or loss and equity would have been affected by changes in the relevant risk variable that were reasonably possible at that date. These ranges of parameters are estimated by management, which are based on the facts and circumstances available at the time estimates are made, and an assumption of stable socio-economic and geopolitical states. No unusual and exceptional events, for example, natural disasters or human-made crises and calamities, are taken into consideration when the sensitivity analysis is prepared. Actual occurrence could differ from these assumptions and such differences could be material.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
<FONT STYLE=" TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Credit risk
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Credit risk is the risk that one party to a financial instrument will fail to discharge an obligation and cause the other party to incur a financial loss. Financial instruments which potentially subject the Group to credit risk consist of cash and cash equivalents, restricted cash, short-term cash deposits, and derivative and credit exposures (including outstanding receivables and committed transactions). The Group has deposited cash and cash equivalents, restricted cash, short-term cash deposits and entered into derivative contracts with reputable financial institutions with high credit ratings, from which management believes the risk of loss to be remote.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Most of the Group&#8217;s credit exposures are with counterparties in the finance and supply chain segment and are subject to normal industry credit risk. The Group has receivables from various entities including, primarily, trade customers. Credit risk from trade account receivables is mitigated since they are credit insured, covered by letters of credit, bank guarantees and/or other credit enhancements. The Group routinely monitors credit risk exposures, including sector, geographic and corporate concentrations of credit and set and regularly review counterparties&#8217; credit limits based on rating agency credit ratings and/or internal assessments of company and industry analysis. The Group also uses factoring and credit insurances to manage credit risk. Management believes that these measures minimize the Group&#8217;s overall credit risk; however, there can be no assurance that these processes will protect the Group against all losses from non-performance.
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:22.72PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:30.62PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4.36PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;">
	129
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR>
</DIV>

	The average contractual credit period for trade receivables is 60-65 days and up to 180 days for certain sales. With the use of factoring facilities, the average cash collection period is reduced to approximately 15 days. For the aging analysis of past-due receivables, see Note 6.
</DIV>

	Guarantees (see Note 23)
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #CCEEFF; WIDTH:6PT;">

<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:10PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING:0PT; WIDTH:6PT;">

</TD>

	$
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING:2.75PT 0PT 2PT 0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000; MIN-WIDTH:24.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT; WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">

</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING:0PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;">
	&#8203;

<TR STYLE="HEIGHT:4.5PT;LINE-HEIGHT:4.5PT;">

	&#8203;

</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:7.51PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	As at December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Group had issued guarantees up to a maximum of&#8201; $14,137 to its trading and financing partners in the normal course of its supply chain activities. As at December&nbsp;31, 2015, $390 were outstanding and have not been recorded as liabilities in the consolidated statement of financial position. Typically, these guarantees are issued on behalf of the Group&#8217;s trading partners and the Group companies. The guarantees issued on behalf of the Group companies are typically issued in favor of trading and financing partners.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:5.02PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	In the preceding five years, no claims were made against the guarantees issued by the Group. Subsequent to December&nbsp;31, 2015, certain guarantees related to a customer filing for insolvency were called and the Group met its obligations under these amounts. Since these guarantees are no longer contingent, but instead are probable, they have been recognized as provisions as at December&nbsp;31, 2015. In case of non-performance by a trading partner and a claim made against the Group, the Group can make the claim against the defaulting trading partner and has a pledge on the goods as well as other assets to recover the loss. The Group can also get reimbursements from various other forms of collateral and risk mitigation securities (see Note 23).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:5.02PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Please see sub-heading of&#8201; &#8220;Concentration risk&#8221; in this Note 26 on credit risk concentration.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
<FONT STYLE=" TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Liquidity risk
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4.02PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Liquidity risk is the risk that an entity will encounter difficulty in raising funds to meet commitments associated with financial instruments. The Group requires liquidity specifically to fund capital requirements, satisfy financial obligations as they become due, and to operate its finance and supply chain business. The Group puts in place an actively managed production and capital expenditure budgeting process for major capital programs. The Group&#8217;s approach to managing liquidity is to ensure, as far as possible, that it always has sufficient liquidity to meet its liabilities when they fall due, under normal and stress conditions, without incurring unacceptable losses. The Group maintains an adequate level of liquidity, with a portion of its assets held in cash and cash equivalents. The Group also maintains adequate banking facilities, including factoring arrangements. It is the Group&#8217;s policy to invest cash in highly liquid, diversified money market funds or bank deposits for a period of less than three months. The Group may also invest in cash deposits with an original maturity date of more than three months so as to earn higher interest income.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:5.02PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Generally, trade payables are due within 90 days and other payables and accrued expenses are due within one year. All derivative financial liabilities are to be settled within one year. All short-term bank borrowings are renewable on a yearly basis. Please also refer to Note 15 for the Group&#8217;s debt maturity schedule. The schedule of future payments is based on the Group&#8217;s historical payment patterns and management&#8217;s interpretation of contractual arrangements. The actual cash outflows might occur significantly earlier than indicated in the schedule or be for significantly different amounts from those indicated in the schedule.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
<FONT STYLE=" TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Currency risk
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4.02PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Currency risk is the risk that the value of a financial instrument will fluctuate due to changes in foreign exchange rates. Currency risk does not arise from financial instruments that are non-monetary items or
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:22.72PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:30.62PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4.36PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;">
	130
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage141"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS; WIDTH:596.6PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI, ARIAL, SANS-SERIF;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:8PT;">
<A STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;COLOR:#003366;" HREF="#T1600851-20F_HTM_TOC">
	TABLE OF CONTENTS
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:48.82PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	MFC BANCORP LTD.
<BR>
	(FORMERLY MFC INDUSTRIAL LTD.)
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
<BR>
	DECEMBER 31, 2015
<BR>
	&#8199;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:1PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 26.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Financial Instruments&#8201;(continued)
<BR>
	&#8199;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:1PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	from financial instruments denominated in the functional currency. The Group operates internationally and is exposed to risks from changes in foreign currency rates, particularly the Euro, Canadian dollar and U.S. dollar. Currency risk arises principally from future trading transactions, and recognized assets and liabilities. In order to reduce the Group&#8217;s exposure to foreign currency risk on material contracts (including intercompany loans) denominated in foreign currencies (other than the functional currencies of the Group companies), the Group may use foreign currency forward contracts and options to protect its financial positions. As at December&nbsp;31, 2015, in its continuing operations, the Group had foreign currency derivative financial instruments (foreign currency forward contracts and options) with aggregate notional amounts of $162,051 (2014: $255,906) and a net unrealized fair value gain of&#8201; $2,492 (2014: $2,795).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	The Group does not have any material exposure to highly inflationary foreign currencies.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE=" TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Sensitivity analysis:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2015, if the U.S. dollar had weakened 10% against the Group companies&#8217; functional currencies with all other variables held constant, loss from continuing operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 would have been $1,156 higher. Conversely, if the U.S. dollar had strengthened 10% against the local functional currencies with all other variables held constant, loss from continuing operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 would have been $1,156 lower. The reason for such change is mainly due to certain U.S. dollar denominated financial instrument liabilities (net of assets) held by entities whose functional currencies were not the U.S. dollar. There would have been no material impact arising from financial instruments on other comprehensive income in either case.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2015, if the Euro had weakened 10% against the Group companies&#8217; functional currencies with all other variables held constant, loss from continuing operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 would have been $4,317 lower. Conversely, if the Euro had strengthened 10% against the local functional currencies with all other variables held constant, loss from continuing operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 would have been $3,217 higher. The reason for such change is mainly due to certain currency derivative contracts held by entities whose functional currencies were not the Euro. There would have been no impact arising from financial instruments on other comprehensive income in either case.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2015, if the Canadian dollars had weakened 10% against the Group companies&#8217; functional currencies with all other variables held constant, loss from continuing operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 would have been $583 higher. Conversely, if the Canadian dollars had strengthened 10% against the local functional currencies with all other variables held constant, loss from continuing operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 would have been $583 lower. The reason for such change is mainly due to certain Canadian dollar-denominated financial assets (net of liabilities) held by entities whose functional currencies were not the Canadian dollars. There would have been no impact arising from financial instruments on other comprehensive income in either case.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
<FONT STYLE=" TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Interest rate risk
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Interest rate risk is the risk that the fair value or future cash flows of a financial instrument will fluctuate due to changes in market interest rates. Short-term financial assets and financial liabilities are generally not exposed to significant interest rate risk, because of their short-term nature. The Group&#8217;s long-term debt is not exposed to significant interest rate cash flow risk as the interest rates have been fixed for approximately 72% of the Group&#8217;s long-term debt.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE=" TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Sensitivity analysis:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2015, if benchmark interest rates (such as LIBOR or prime rates) at that date had been 100 basis points (1.00%) per annum lower with all other variables held constant, loss from continuing operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 would have been $2,202 lower, arising mainly as a result of lower net interest expense. Conversely, if benchmark interest rates at that date had been 100 basis points
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:22.72PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:30.62PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4.36PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;">
	131
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage142"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS; WIDTH:596.6PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI, ARIAL, SANS-SERIF;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:8PT;">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	MFC BANCORP LTD.
<BR>
	(FORMERLY MFC INDUSTRIAL LTD.)

	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
<BR>
	DECEMBER 31, 2015
<BR>
	&#8199;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:1PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 26.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Financial Instruments&#8201;(continued)
<BR>
	&#8199;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:1PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	(1.00%) per annum higher with all other variables held constant, loss from continuing operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 would have been $2,202 higher, arising mainly as a result of higher net interest expense. There would have been no impact arising from financial instruments on the Group&#8217;s other comprehensive income.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
<FONT STYLE=" TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Other price risk
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Other price risk is the risk that the value of a financial instrument will fluctuate as a result of changes in market prices, whether those changes are caused by factors specific to the individual instrument or its issuer or factors affecting all instruments traded in the market. The Group&#8217;s other price risk includes equity price risk whereby the Group&#8217;s investments in equities of other entities that are classified as held for trading or available for sale are subject to market price fluctuations. The Group did not hold any asset-backed securities.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE=" TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Sensitivity analysis:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2015, if the equity price in general had weakened 10% with all other variables held constant, loss and other comprehensive income from continuing operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 would have been $33 higher and $60 lower, respectively. Conversely, if the equity price in general had strengthened 10% with all other variables held constant, loss and other comprehensive income from continuing operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 would have been $33 lower and $60 higher, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	In addition, the Group buys and sells futures contracts on the London Metal Exchange and enters into financial derivative contracts (e.g. futures and swaps) with banks, customers and brokers. Management uses the financial derivative contracts to manage the price fluctuations for its own account or for customers. As at December&nbsp;31, 2015 in its continuing operations, the Group had outstanding derivative financial instruments with an aggregate notional amount of&#8201; $43,820 (2014:$21,277), respectively, primarily to hedge against the long position in inventories and the usage of energy, which resulted in a net unrealized fair value loss of&#8201; $1,002 (2014: fair value gain of&#8201; $848).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE=" TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Sensitivity analysis:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2015, if the underlying price in the financial instrument contracts in general had weakened 10% with all other variables held constant, loss from continuing operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 would have been $147 higher. Conversely, if the underlying price in the financial instrument contracts in general had strengthened 10% with all other variables held constant, loss from continuing operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 would have been $147 lower. There would have been no impact arising from financial instruments on other comprehensive income in either case.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	The Group executes contracts with third parties for the sale and physical delivery of inventory so as to achieve a targeted price. Such contracts are not typically financial instruments and therefore are excluded from the fair value disclosures and sensitivity analysis.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
<FONT STYLE=" TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Concentration risk
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Management determines the concentration risk threshold amount as any single financial asset (or liability) exceeding 10% of total financial assets (or liabilities) in the Group&#8217;s consolidated statement of financial position.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	The Group regularly maintains cash balances in financial institutions in excess of insured limits. The Group has deposited cash and cash equivalents, restricted cash and term deposits with reputable financial institutions with high credit ratings, and management believes the risk of loss to be remote. As at December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Group had cash and cash equivalents aggregating $56,107 and an investment of $102 in a banking group in Austria. The Group also owed $163,326 in aggregate short-term banking borrowings and debt to the Austria banking group and had derivative contracts with an aggregate notional
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:22.72PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:30.62PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4.36PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;">
	132
</DIV>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI, ARIAL, SANS-SERIF;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:8PT;">

	TABLE OF CONTENTS
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:48.82PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	MFC BANCORP LTD.

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:1PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 26.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Financial Instruments&#8201;(continued)
<BR>
	&#8199;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:1PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	amount of&#8201; $140,540 with the Austria banking group. In addition, as of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the assets held for sale included cash and cash equivalent of&#8201; $2,286 with and the liabilities relating to the assets held for sale included short-term banking borrowings and debt of&#8201; $31,486 due to the same Austria banking group.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	A customer filed for insolvency in 2016. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Group recognized trade receivables of&#8201; $92,595 due from the customer and its affiliates, net of allowance for credit losses.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
<FONT STYLE=" TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Additional disclosure
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:20PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 27.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Fair Value Disclosure of Non-financial Assets
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	The fair values of the Group&#8217;s financial instrument assets and liabilities which are measured at fair value on the consolidated statements of financial position are discussed in Note 26. The following tables present non-financial assets which are measured at fair value in the consolidated statements of financial position, classified by the fair value hierarchy;
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12.49PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Commodity inventories are measured at fair value less costs to sell. The fair values are determined by reference to their contractual selling prices or quoted prices in marketplaces in the absence of a contract (level 1 fair value hierarchy). An average of past sale prices is used when there are no observable market prices or current contracts but there have been recent past sales of such goods and there are no indications that the market prices have been materially impacted (level 2 fair value hierarchy).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	The fair values of investment property are measured using an income approach which includes the following inputs: land value, realized basic rents, operating costs, discount rates and damages and defects (level 2 fair value hierarchy). The valuation approach is consistent in both 2015 and 2014, except that the 2014 valuation was performed by an independent external valuator and the 2015 update was performed by internal management as management concluded there were no major changes in the input factors since 2014.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 28.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;MFC Bancorp and its Significant Subsidiaries
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	MFC Bancorp has its principal executive office at Suite 1860 &#8211; 400 Burrard Street, Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	A subsidiary is an entity that is controlled by MFC Bancorp. The following table shows the Company&#8217;s direct and indirect significant subsidiaries as at December&nbsp;31, 2015. The table excludes subsidiaries which only hold intercompany assets and liabilities and do not have an active business as well as subsidiaries whose results and net assets did not materially impact the consolidated results and net assets of the Group.
</DIV>

<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TD STYLE="PADDING:0PT; WIDTH:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING:4PT 0PT 0.5PT 0PT; WIDTH:283.55PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<DIV STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	Hangzhou Zhe-er Optical Co. Ltd.
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING:0PT; WIDTH:6PT;">
	&#8203;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING:0PT; WIDTH:6PT;">
	&#8203;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING:4PT 0PT 0.5PT 0PT; WIDTH:70.9PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
	China
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING:0PT; WIDTH:6PT;">
	&#8203;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING:0PT; WIDTH:6PT;">
	&#8203;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING:0PT;PADDING-LEFT:10.545PT;WIDTH:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING:4PT 0PT 0.5PT 0PT; MIN-WIDTH:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT; ">
	&#8203;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING:4PT 0PT 0.5PT 0PT; MIN-WIDTH:11.25PT; TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT; WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	51
<FONT STYLE="POSITION:ABSOLUTE;">
	%
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING:0PT;PADDING-LEFT:10.545PT;WIDTH:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING:0PT; WIDTH:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:15.59PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	As at December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Group controlled entities in which the Group held more than 50% of the voting rights and did not control any entities in which the Group held 50% or less of the voting rights. The Group&#8217;s proportional voting interests in the subsidiaries are identical to its proportional beneficial interests, except for a non-wholly-owned subsidiary in Africa from which the Group derives a 100% beneficial interest resulting from holding a shareholder loan. As at December&nbsp;31, 2015, none of non-controlling interests are material to the Group. Also, there were no significant restrictions (statutory, contractual and regulatory restrictions, including protective rights of non-controlling interests) on MFC Bancorp&#8217;s ability to access or use the assets and settle the liabilities of the Group.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	During the year ended December&nbsp;2015, the Group sold a 95% economic interest in certain hydrocarbon assets and the related liabilities to a third party for nominal and contingent consideration and derecognized the former subsidiaries holding these assets and liabilities. As a result, the Group recognized a non-cash post-tax loss of&#8201; $11,987 upon the deconsolidation (see Note 4).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, the Group disposed of a group of German entities (see Note 23) and recognized an accounting gain of&#8201; $4,535 on the derecognition of these former subsidiaries in the consolidated statement of operations. The Group also disposed of three inactive wholly-owned subsidiaries for cash consideration, resulting in a net gain of&#8201; $353.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, the Group purchased the remaining 40% equity interest in Possehl (see Note 25). As a result, Possehl became a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Group since April&nbsp;2014, the date the remaining 40% equity interests were acquired.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, the Group sold its interest in a group (which held the resource properties in India) and recognized a non-cash accounting gain of&#8201; $427 on disposition (see Note 23). The gain was included in net sales in the consolidated statement of operations. The Group also acquired the non-controlling interests a consolidated structured entity) and another group. There was no income or loss resulting from the transactions and non-controlling interests aggregating $2,503 were reclassified to retained earnings. The Group also credited $1,968 to retained earnings in 2013 when it acquired the remaining equity interest in MFC Resources Inc.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 29.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Subsequent Event
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
<FONT STYLE=" TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Purchase of assets
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	On January&nbsp;5, 2016, the Group purchased certain assets from a former subsidiary for $790 at their fair value. The purchase consideration was recorded as a reduction in the amount due from the former subsidiary.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
<FONT STYLE=" TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Business combination
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	On January&nbsp;11, 2016, the Company received all necessary regulatory approvals and, on February&nbsp;1, 2016, completed the acquisition of BAWAG Malta Bank Ltd. (the &#8220;Bank&#8221;), a Western European bank. Subsequent to the acquisition, the Bank changed its name to MFC Merchant Bank Ltd.
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:22.72PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:30.62PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4.36PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;">
	135
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage146"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS; WIDTH:596.6PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI, ARIAL, SANS-SERIF;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:8PT;">
<A STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;COLOR:#003366;" HREF="#T1600851-20F_HTM_TOC">
	TABLE OF CONTENTS
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:48.82PT;HEIGHT:710.23PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	MFC BANCORP LTD.
<BR>
	(FORMERLY MFC INDUSTRIAL LTD.)
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
<BR>
	DECEMBER 31, 2015
<BR>
	&#8199;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:1PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 29.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Subsequent Event&#8201;(continued)
<BR>
	&#8199;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:1PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	As part of the Group, the Bank will not engage in retail banking, commercial banking or universal banking, but instead will provide specialty banking services and focus on structured and trade finance to the Group&#8217;s customers, suppliers, and group members, among others. In order to maintain a variable cost structure, the Bank will outsource major back office services as well as internal functions such as technology, internal audit and payment services to third parties.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Pursuant to the transaction, the Group acquired the Bank for total purchase consideration of $142,417 which equaled the fair values of the identifiable assets acquired and the liabilities assumed on the closing date.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	This acquisition was not considered as a material business combination.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 30.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Approval of Consolidated Financial Statements
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	These consolidated financial statements were approved by the Board of Directors and authorized for issue on May&nbsp;2, 2016.
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:22.72PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:30.62PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">

	136

	(1)

<A NAME="T1600851_EX12-1_HTM"></A>
<EFX_EXHIBIT_12>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_12"></A>
<DIV STYLE=" WIDTH:596.6PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI, ARIAL, SANS-SERIF;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:8PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:48.82PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:64.6999999999999PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	EXHIBIT 12.1&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	SARBANES-OXLEY CEO CERTIFICATION
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	I, Gerardo Cortina, certify that:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:20PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	1.
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:414.05PT;">
	I have reviewed this annual report on Form 20-F of MFC Industrial Ltd.;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:20PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	2.
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:414.05PT;">
	Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:20PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	3.
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:414.05PT;">
	Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the company as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:20PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:8.99PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	4.
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:8.99PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:414.05PT;">
	The company&#8217;s other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the company and have:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:40PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	a.
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:394.05PT;">
	Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the company, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:40PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	b.
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:394.05PT;">
	Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:40PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:8.99PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	c.
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:8.99PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:394.05PT;">
	Evaluated the effectiveness of the company&#8217;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:40PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	d.
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:394.05PT;">
	Disclosed in this report any change in the company&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the period covered by the annual report that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the company&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting; and
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:20PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	5.
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:414.05PT;">
	The company&#8217;s other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the company&#8217;s auditors and the audit committee of the company&#8217;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:40PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:8.99PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	a.
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:8.99PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:394.05PT;">
	All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the company&#8217;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:40PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	b.
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:394.05PT;">
	Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the company&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;

<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI, ARIAL, SANS-SERIF;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:8PT;">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	I, Samuel Morrow, certify that:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:20PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	1.
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT; WIDTH:414.05PT;">
	I have reviewed this annual report on Form 20-F of MFC Industrial Ltd.;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:20PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	2.
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:414.05PT;">
	Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:20PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	3.
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:414.05PT;">
	Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the company as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:20PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:8.99PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	4.
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:8.99PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:414.05PT;">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:40PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	a.
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:394.05PT;">
	Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the company, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:40PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	b.
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:394.05PT;">

<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:40PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:8.99PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">

	&#8203;

<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:40PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	d.

<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI, ARIAL, SANS-SERIF;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:8PT;">

	EXHIBIT 13.1&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
</DIV>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:20PT; MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	In connection with the annual report of MFC Industrial Ltd. (the &#8220;Company&#8221;) on Form 20-F for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, as filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on the date hereof (the &#8220;Annual Report&#8221;), I, Gerardo Cortina, as Chief Executive Officer of the Company, hereby certify pursuant to 18 U.S.C. Section 1350, as adopted pursuant to Section 906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, that, to the best of my knowledge:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:20PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	(i)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:414.05PT;">
	the Annual Report fully complies with the requirements of Section 13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended; and
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:20PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:8.99PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	(ii)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:8.99PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:414.05PT;">
	the information contained in the Annual Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the Company.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Date: May&nbsp;2, 2016
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">

</FONT>
<BR>
	By: Gerardo Cortina
<BR>
	Title: Chief Executive Officer
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	This certification accompanies this Annual Report pursuant to Section 906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 and shall not, except to the extent required by such Act, be deemed filed by the Company for purposes of Section 18 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &#8220;Exchange Act&#8221;). <EFX_EXHIBIT_13>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_13_2"></A>
<DIV STYLE=" WIDTH:596.6PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI, ARIAL, SANS-SERIF;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:8PT;">

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:48.82PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:64.6999999999999PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">

	EXHIBIT 13.2&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	CERTIFICATION OF
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	18 U.S.C. SECTION 1350,
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	AS ADOPTED PURSUANT TO
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	SECTION 906 OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:20PT; MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	In connection with the annual report of MFC Industrial Ltd. (the &#8220;Company&#8221;) on Form 20-F for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, as filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on the date hereof (the &#8220;Annual Report&#8221;), I, Samuel Morrow, as Chief Financial Officer of the Company, hereby certify pursuant to 18 U.S.C. Section 1350, as adopted pursuant to Section 906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, that, to the best of my knowledge:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:20PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	(i)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:8.98PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:414.05PT;">
	the Annual Report fully complies with the requirements of Section 13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended; and
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:20PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:8.99PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:20PT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
	(ii)
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE=" FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-TOP:8.99PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:414.05PT;">
	the information contained in the Annual Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the Company.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; PADDING:0PT; MARGIN:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	Date: May&nbsp;2, 2016
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE=" TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	/s/ Samuel Morrow&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<BR>
	By: Samuel Morrow
<BR>
	Title: Chief Financial Officer
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	This certification accompanies this Annual Report pursuant to Section 906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 and shall not, except to the extent required by such Act, be deemed filed by the Company for purposes of Section 18 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &#8220;Exchange Act&#8221;). Such certification will not be deemed to be incorporated by reference into any filing under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, or the Exchange Act, except to the extent that the Company specifically incorporates it by reference.

<A NAME="eolPage160"></A>
<A NAME="T1600851_EX16-1_HTM"></A>
<EFX_EXHIBIT_16>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_16"></A>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_98"></A>
<DIV STYLE=" WIDTH:596.6PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI, ARIAL, SANS-SERIF;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:8PT;">
	&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:48.82PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:64.6999999999999PT;MARGIN-LEFT:71.02PT;WIDTH:454.55PT;">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Exhibit 16.1&#8203;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Disclosure of Mine Safety and Health Administration (MSHA) Safety Data
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	MFC Bancorp Ltd.&#8217;s Pea Ridge Mine in the United States is subject to regulation by MSHA under the United States Federal Mine Safety and Health Act of 1977 (the &#8220;Mine Act&#8221;). MSHA inspects mines and issues various citations and orders when it believes a violation has occurred under the Mine Act, and it typically proposes a civil penalty, or fine, related to the alleged violation.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	The following disclosures are provided pursuant to Section 1503(a) of the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act
</FONT>
	(&#8220;Dodd-Frank&#8221;), which requires certain disclosures by companies operating mines regulated under the Mine Act and which are required to file periodic reports under the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Securities Exchange Act of 1934
</FONT>
	.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Pea Ridge Mine did not receive a written notice from MSHA of&#8201; (a) a pattern of violations of mandatory health or safety standards that are of such nature as could have significantly and substantially contributed to the cause and effect of mine health or safety hazards under section 104(e) of the Mine Act or (b) the potential to have such a pattern.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	The information in the table below reflects citations and orders issued by MSHA inspectors to the relevant Pea Ridge Mine site during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. This data may not match or reconcile with the data MSHA maintains on its public website.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;">
	In evaluating this information, consideration should be given to factors such as: (a) the number of citations and orders may vary depending on the size, nature of operations and operational status of the mine, (b) the number of citations issued may vary from inspector to inspector and mine to mine, and (c) citations and orders may be contested and appealed, a process which may result in a reduction in severity and amount, or they might be dismissed.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; WIDTH:454.55PT; LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Mine Safety Disclosures
</DIV>

<TD STYLE="PADDING:3.5PT 0PT 1.5PT 0PT; WIDTH:422.55PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
